description:
This was a great spot for a casual, tasty, and reasonably quick lunch.  Good food and wonderfully friendly service in a pleasant setting.

My husband and I popped in on a Sunday afternoon with our 4 month old after a walk along the ocean.  We enjoyed an order of the tandoori chicken wings, which were flavorful.  I really liked my slice of Indian vegetarian pizza which was fresh and delicious.  My husband thought his tandoori chicken sandwich was decent.  Both the pizza slice and sandwich were quite big, and smallest wings order size was 10 pieces, so we had leftovers to take home with us.

The staff was very friendly and helpful!  We had sat down at a small table, and they encouraged us to move to a bigger table so we had room to spread out, which was thoughtful.  There was space to park out baby's stroller next to our table, which was convenient.  They seemed to genuinely want to make sure we had a pleasant experience, which we appreciated.

The space is simple, clean, and comfortable.  The walls have old photographs of San Francisco on them, which is pretty cool.

Overall, this was a nice find!
author: Barnali D.

description:
This place is iconic for the Parkside and Ocean beach. If you ever visited ocean beach at taraval most likely you stopped by afterwards and got a slice of pizza. Or - after a drink at Riptide, another Parkside favorite.

These guys been in business for decades, and the team is so efficient. Usually I get Brothers special, or vegetarian special, but they also have pastas, Indian food, breads. And chicken wings!

Wendy and Ken are the best!! You are guys are amazing.
author: Dimi N.

description:
Great pizza
Awesome owners 
Veggie Indian pizza wit Paneer was best
Will come back always
author: Anish G.

description: Still the best pizza in SF! While I can't claim to be a pizza guru,  I still claim that is the best and most generous toppings pizza joint in SF. GREAT service too!
author: Tony L.

description: We ordered pizza from here using yelp during the Super Bowl and it was awesome. We got a deal for an extra large pizza and wings for super cheap. Even during the super bowl our order was ready quickly. We picked it up and finished watching the game next door at the riptide. A+ pizza. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
author: Angela T.

description:
Love Singh and Wendy and this place. It's been here forever. They have pizza, Indian food and Indian pizza. I had a huge slice of chicken tikka masala pizza for $5 dollars. It was tasty and I brought it to Riptide next door. Open until Midnight on weekend nights.

Reminds me of the quirky, diverse, friendly San Francisco I used to love.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Disorganized.
Crabby workers.
Overall awkward experience for shitty pizza. Luckily this place is outside my usual route.

Give it a try - maybe they won't f--k up your order and keep you waiting 20 minutes for the wrong slice of pizza.
author: Ross H.

description:
Oh Brother does this Pepperoni pizza disappoint.

I was in a rush and come in here as got a greasy, overpriced slice of funny tasting dough and weird tasting cheese.
author: Jack R.

description:
Hands down best pizza I've ever had!

Their Italian Sausage pizza is super bomb!

Other than being a great pizza joint, the brothers are great humanitarians.

The Two Brothers know how to do it!

On the day of 1989 Earthquake, we didn't have electricity, brothers gave free slices of pizza to anyone that came in. 

I'm getting emotional writing this! I'm going to write a yelp* review.
author: Kenny C.

description:
This was my first time ordering delivery pizza from here. I checked the reviews and it seemed fine so I gave it a shot. I ordered a veggie pizza and chicken Alfredo pasta. 

As I began to serve my boyfriend and I, I noticed the pizza underneath was extremely wet.. the entire inside/middle was soggy. I was confused and had no idea why. We continued to try it because we were both starving but it was so soggy I couldn't take another bite. I opted for eating the crust because I didn't want to waste it/ I had just paid all this money for a pizza. And to make matters worse my pasta had absolutely no flavor and the chicken was missing...

I wanted to let the restaurant know about my experience so that it won't be happening to others. They told me that my pizza was soggy because I ordered the "veggie" and that's what happens when's you make a veggie pizza? I have never experienced that in the past. I kindly asked for a refund since I barely ate any. The women on the phone even asked if 90% of the pizza was left and I said yes. She then said she asked the owner about the refund but his response was " a 7 dollar credit for my next purchase" It's 11 pm now and I'm tired so I didn't feel like arguing my way into getting a refund so I kindly said ok goodnight. 

I am a broke college student who paid $30 for a meal I didn't eat. It's not acceptable to send a soggy pizza and pasta that has missing chicken and no flavor. I won't be using my 7 dollar credit because I won't be ordering from here again. 

Hope this doesn't happen to anyone else, don't order the veggie ;)
author: Nikki A.

description: First time coming to this pizza place, even though I have been living in the area for over ten years. Call in 15 minutes before hand and when I got there everything was ready to go. The pizza was hot, right out of the oven and it was really good. The hot wing was good too.
author: Steven L.

description:
The Indian-style vegetarian pizza is LIFE-CHANGING. :)

Perfect dough w/ tikka masala sauce, spinach, broccoli, garlic, mozzarella cheese. OMG #nomz
author: Julie D.

description: Honestly the worst bite of pizza I've ever had in my life. The delivery order was messed up. I take one bite and get an entire pool of grease in my mouth (I almost gagged and spit it out). The cheese is completely separated from the crust, it's like cardboard. The jalapeño poppers were inedible as well. HOW does this place have good reviews?! Baffled over here. I've eaten some bad pizza in my day but this takes the cake.
author: Pearl M.

description: Love this place!!  Best pizza and that crust!! Not to mention the homemade ranch is great.
author: Chuck L.

description:
Excellent little pizza shop in the sunset district. They have a lot of options to choose such as
Chicken pesto and tandoori chicken. I ordered a medium (which is more like a large!) half Hawaiian half pepperoni, onion, sausage and green pepper. They both were really good and I wanted to keep eating. The crust wasn't too thin or too thick, it was just right. Definitely will be going back. Also, you can get any type of pizza by the slice.
author: Luke S.

description: It's the neighborhood pizza joint. Nothing fancy here. Sometimes you just want a large greasy slice of pizza, ain't nothing wrong with that.
author: Janet S.

description:
After three years in sunset I have a favorite pizza.

They have cheap, fast and hot melting delivery. The pizza is LOADED with greasy delicious quality cheese. The bottom is crunchy and the crust is puffy (order the bigger crust.)

Just darn good stuff. If you love cartoonish mutant turtle pizza ignore the bad reviews and give it a chance
author: Veda Z.

description:
I placed an order through Grubhub. It took about an hour an a half to get an update on the order, and when I did the driver was at the wrong delivery address. I explained that it must have been an issue with the Grubhub app and asked if he would be able to deliver to the correct address. The driver said he would talk to his manager and call me back, but never did. Forty minutes later I called and asked for an update, and the driver said he could not deliver.

I spent a month going back and forth with Grubhub and the restaurant. Ultimately the restaurant would not refund the $60 order.
author: Kevin H.

description:
Unpretentious neighborhood place! Extensive Italian AND Indian choices! I couldn't decide, do I created my own fusion cuisine dish by combining two of my favorites:
Palak Paneer over Ravioli

Decisions!! And the sweet order taker graciously accommodated.
author: Wendy A.

description:
Pizza is good but prepared to be nickeled and dimed and always check before you leave to make sure the extra toppings you paid for are actually on your pizza. 
Want a side of ranch? No problem... If you don't mind paying a fortune.
author: Amy P.

description:
Sure enough, the delivery is spot on. 
Best pizza in the area!! 

The crust does run thick though.
author: Daniel C.

description:
Good neighborhood place. In a great neighborhood. Right next door to the Riptide, how convenient.
We had The Brothers Special Pizza. Meaty and cheesy goodness in the best way. Very tasty. We had dinner and breakfast from a medium sized pizza. When we go back I'd like to taste the tandoori chicken pizza. Chicken tikka masala.
author: Beautiful F.

description:
It was really late and I haven't been to SF very often. I was with my GF to take her to the airport. We were really hungry and looking for something quick and open late. I found this place via Yelp and ordered online with 15 mins till they closed. When I got there they were stacking chairs and sweeping up. Everyone inside was smiling and laughing and happy to help me. No sense of frustration that I ordered so late. 

The pizza was delicious and really made our night. I'm grateful.
author: Jonathan F.

description: My favorite pizza place since moving to SF great by the slice, great deal too. Closest thing I have found to New York style slices in the city. Always fast and friendly delivery is also great! Highly recommend to anyone who struggles to find a pizza place that gets the sauce/cheese/crust ratio just right.
author: Valerie M.

description: so disappointed tonight...where are my toppings? big gaps of no meat on my sausage pepperoni mushroom pizza.
author: n y.

description: I have been pretty loyal to this place. However as of recent they cannot get a simple request right. I have asked for parmesan and peppers idk how many damn times. Seriously drives me crazy that something that simple cannot be done. When I ask the drivers they say call back. Why can you not carry parm and peppers in the delivery vehicle. I have ordered my last pizza from here.
author: Michael W.

description: Bread wasn't buttery, tomatoes and cheese were gross and soggy. But they did deliver fast.
author: Bianca C.

description:
This my go too place for a pizza. Best pizza in San Francisco. Ordered my usual. Large mushroom, olives, sausage, pepperoni, and garlic. 
It was cooked to perfection. The dough was fully cooked and tad bit crispy on the bottom. The mushrooms tasted like mushrooms, and the sausage was very very flavorful. The sauce, can or no can was tangy and sweat and made my mouth burst with flavor. 
Would i recommend this place? Hell yeah!!!
author: Richie R.

description: Great option in the neighborhood... but be sure to let it cool! The delivery is too fast (in a good way)
author: Reg D.

description: Good prices, good pizza, friendly service.  The chicken tikka masala pizza and tandoori chicken  Pizza are unique and tasty if you want to try something different.  The slices are big enough for a meal, and you can take them next door to eat at Riptide!
author: H K.

description: I loooooove Brothers Pizza! So cheesy and delicious. Their pesto cheese bread is amazing too!
author: Kayla Q.

description: I have been getting take out dishes and pizza from here for years. Friendly people plus great food equals success. Something is working because they have been my late night go to for over 20 years. Tonight was spaghetti/raviolis​ with a side salad. Just right for a quick dinner to go after work. San Francisco Gem in the Sunset.
author: Tim C.

description: Best pizza I've ever had in my life. The pizza here is sooo good, it's almost "Juicy". Came here years ago when my sister only lived 1 block away and came to visit the zoo just yesterday with my family and had to stop!!! We got a small pepperoni and mushroom pizza for my son and I and my gosh it was huge and we loved it. My son fell in love also!! I can't wait to come back here again because Brother's pizza is sooooo delicious and tasty and the owners are so nice, you can tell it's a family business. So much flavor and so much cheese! Hubby got 2 slices of cheese pizza and it was almost bigger than my small pizza!!! Very good.... 5STARS!!!
author: Cali Girl M.

description:
EDIT: My first experience getting the Tandoori & Tikka combo was horrible, and I thought I won't ever go back, but since I live only 2 blocks from here I guess it's inevitable that I do. I've since had their Chicken Tikka Masala pizza and I have to say it is incredible. Such a unique concept and wonderfully done. Their margarita pizza is also great. Also, one slice of their pizza is enough to feed two! Giving this place another star since I've realized it's really not that bad haha. 

Just been here once as it's walking distance from our apartment, but probably won't go back. Ordered the Tandoori & Tikka Combo and it was ridiculously salty. I could barely eat it. I had to go to the store and get plain yogurt to make the dish the least bit palatable. Not worth the $13 I paid! Giving 2 stars since the quantity of food was good and would get you full - would have actually been worth the money if only it tasted a bit better. The Dal it came with wasn't too bad either. Still, would rather cook something myself at home than spend money here.
author: Trisha D.

description: Solid pizza. Can be a bit greasy at times, but it is still solid. The appetizers are great--the garlic bread is one of the few in the city I've bothered to get a second time. A great post-beach take-out option.
author: Jon L.

description:
Customer service: thumbs up.
Husband and I came in from a long day of walking around Golden Gate Park. We were hungry and I was dehydrated and had no idea how to order, I just wanted pizza.
I began by asking question after question and the kid at the register gladly answered all my questions with no attitude of any kind. We ordered 4 slices of pizza (TWO would have been enough!) And two bottles of water. Kid asked if we wanted a cup of water instead but we passed.

Food: sideways thumb.
The wait wasn't too long, it was reasonable. The pizza was OK. It was pizza. Huge, and I mean HUUGE pizza slices. Thick crust around the edge but it's pretty thin on the actual pizza topping part. I thought it was flavorful. Honestly though, the simple Pesto Cheese Bread was my favorite.

Halfway through eating the ¾ of the pizza slice I ate, I finished my bottled water and wanted more but didn't want to pay for another, so I took up the kids offer for a glass of water. He proceeded to get a cup and poured me cold water from a pitcher in the drink cooler. I mentioned that I thought I was dehydrated and he told me to come back when I wanted more. Aww.

Other: Decor was a little weird. Plain. Minimal effort. TV was on some weird shopping channel.

And they also have Indian food. Didn't try it, just thought I'd mention it.
author: Amy A.

description:
Cheese sticks were soggy and cold.
Salad was yellow and not fresh. It had watery ranch pre mixed in.
Indian style vegetarian pizza was soggy and sub par in flavor. 

Two stars only for quickness of delivery.
author: Kevin B.

description: It pains me to do this, because I've been going to Brother's since I was a kid, but they just delivered to me the soggiest mess of a pizza that I've ever had. Soup bread, man. Their quality is beyond lacking these days. I've always known to never order anything bigger than a large from them, but fuck! How the hell am I supposed to keep recommending local shops to people if you're going to do me like this?
author: Timmy F.

description: This was my favorite place in my old neighborhood for many, many years. The green and white pizza is fabulous. They have other great food besides pizza as well. Unfortunately, gentrification and random "greening" of that block has reduced the available parking, so you may have to park several blocks away if you want to check it out. But it's worth it anyway! The owners are total sweethearts, and even though it doesn't look like much from the outside, I promise you won't regret going.
author: Kristen L.

description: Pizza slice is not very good. Almost deep dish like crust and pepperoni is buried under the cheese so it doesn't get cooked properly or at least cooked the way I like it. Prices are fine beer and a slice $10. However I then asked for some ranch and they charged .75 which is fine however the container was 1/3 full and I would have had to buy another just to enjoy one full slice and ranch on it.
author: Charles D.

description:
I ordered the all meat special through Eat24 and was delivered a delicious looking pizza , after eating a full piece I started on another , took a bite and realized that all of the sausage on the pizza was RAW. I was shocked , I pulled all of the sausage from the remaining pizza and pulled it apart to find ALL of the sausage was raw in the center , cold and red in the middle . I am not a picky person and I'm not a finicky eater but this was disgusting RAW PORK SAUSAGE , I'm completely blown away that they would serve someone this , I immediately let Eat 24 know and they refunded me right away, then Brothers pizza insisted they come pick up the pizza .
Do not order from here , do not eat here , avoid  Brothers Pizza to save your stomach suffering .
author: Evan P.

description:
Ugh. We came in when it was empty about 3pm on a Wednesday, ordered a small size of half brothers special (their combo) and half pesto  which was about $14 on the menu. We paid for extra bacon on the whole pizza for an extra two bucks. Finally got the pizza, I checked and there was no bacon. I asked the worker if bacon was added and he hesitated when looking at it and looked at the workers that made the pizza, and just looked at me saying it's underneath the toppings and cheese.. Wtf? I don't know who puts bacon underneath the cheese but ok. I didn't wanna bother so once we left and ate the pizza, there was no bacon. The pizza itself was decent, nothing great. The pesto pizza was pretty oily and the whole top came off easily but oh well, the bacon was the part that got to me.. If you don't think there's bacon, just add it instead of lying! I paid for it!

Overall not worth $17+ for a small pizza and I wouldn't come back.
author: Cassie T.

description: Good neighborhood spot for a quick bite or pick up. The people here are nice and food is hit or miss. Try the tandoori chicken pizza and wings, they're good!
author: Sam Y.

description: Been coming here since I was a kid!!! Pizza slices were like 1.50!!!! But that was a long time ago! Yes they probably switched owners and some things have changed but I still love their pizza!!! Loyal customer for life!! Brothers and Seniore's are pretty much the best pizza places in the sunset! Want something fancy.....take ur ass to north beach or Burlingame....us original San Franciscans like our simple delicious (still pretty fairly priced) pizza.....
author: Nicole P.

description:
Fast and friendly! They have great pizza by the slice or whole pies, as well as some good Indian grub. I liked their Roasted Tandoori Tikka Yellow. I did not like their garlic naan. It is just WAY too thick. Their Dal is good too. 

Get the Roasted Tandoori Tikka Yellow with rice. The Dal came along with it but not sure if that was standard. Under $15 and done within 15min with a drink and I was stuffed plus had leftovers for the next day.
author: Bella B.

description:
I am extremely disappointed with Brothers Pizza. To start the order was 30 minutes late(1 hour and 45 minute wait), normally I could looked passed that but not after the experience  I had. We ordered two pizzas, both which had insane amounts of oil on the side of the boxes. When we opened the pizza boxes both pizzas has the cheese and pepperoni  completely had slide over onto one half of the pizza. We started to eat (pizza was like warm and we are 10 minutes from brothers) because we had been doing home improvements all day and were starving but called grubhub to complain. We were fine with just receiving a credit. 

Grubhub called back and informed us that the manager did not believe that the pizza was in the condition and before we can get a refund he wants to see the pizza and bring it back and will give us a fresh one. 

The manager arrive, walked right into the house without knocking( our front door was open due to renovations we were doing) began to move our items on the table to make space for his bag. I showed him the pizza explaining, did not say one word besides "ok" and grabbed the whole pizza not eaten and the remaining pizza, and left. Did not say whether he would refund, bring pizza, nothing.. Silent. 

I would not recommend this place for pizza, not only because the condition of the food but also because of the extremely rude services we received.
author: Megan B.

description:
Brother's honestly has the best pizza I've ever had. My boyfriend introduced me to this place a couple of years ago and it had turned into my go to spot whenever I'm craving pizza.  First of all they have a huge list of toppings, their cheese is super creamy and not oily, and their crust is sooo crunchy and a little thinner than your normal crust pizza, and they are very generous. And usually I'm not a fan of crust but here I eat the entire slice as well as my boyfriends crust that he leaves behind. The last time I ordered a slice of sausage and mushroom and the slice was gigantic it took up half of a pizza box! And omg I've never seen so many mushrooms on one slice of pizza. And their sausage isn't your normal ground beef looking sausage but are thick delicious slices. 

Not only do they have pizza but they have calzones, sandwiches, garlic bread, pastas, wings, soup, and also Indian food.  They also use to have a cute claw machine but it looks like they recently got rid of it.
author: Linz C.

description: I don't understand why this pizza is just watery and you can't keep anything on the dough! This is not what you would pay 30+ dollars for! No sauce either. It looks like they brushed it on and made sure it had the red tone but removing all sauce completely. The toppings look butchered!!! At first it look great but then once picking any slice up, your left with a wet limp slice of dough! .... waste of money. Send pictures later it's too depressing to look at!!!
author: Mariano R.

description:
I have been to Brother's several times, being a nearby neighbor and a Riptide attendee. 

I've always ordered a simple slice of pizza. The pizza has consistently been undercooked (unmelted cheese) and often has patches of red sauce, lacking cheese. It appears that the cook does not want to sell mere slices, and supports his idea by preparing a crappy, soggy slice.

Avoid.
author: P M.

description:
I always end up ordering from this place when I want delivery pizza. I have only ordered from this place online, so I cannot comment on the actual restaurant. 
I like the Tandoori Chicken Pizza and the Chicken Tikka Masala Pizza. As far as pizzas go, these are on the sweet side, which is alright with me. The crust is not as thick as I usually like, and there could always be more sauce on these things, but I generally enjoy the pizzas I order.
When I order one of these to share, the people I share it with are always pleasantly surprised by the flavors, as they are not usual toppings for a pizza parlor. I've even had someone come back to me and say they ordered a pizza from this place after I introduced them to it and that their whole family loved it.
The delivery takes a pretty standard amount of time, maybe an hour at most.
author: Audrey D.

description: Best pizza in the sunset! And there are a lot of options in the sunset. I love the Indian guys in the kitchen they are always nice and welcoming when we come in. It's also good for delivering which is our choice the majority of the time. If you happen to get a slice it's huge you will be full. My go to is sausage, mushroom, and pineapple!!!! If you go for pick up parking can be a drag. Bought to order some right now!!!!
author: Roxanne O.

description: This pizza is a sloppy greasy mess. A disgrace to the name of pizza. I have high expectations of pizza being from New York but still, this slop doesn't deserve the title of pizza. In the name of pizza, just stop, Brothers, just stop.
author: Samantha S.

description: I would look elsewhere for your neighborhood pizza place. Husband and I moved back to the neighborhood I grew up in. After raving about Brother's, we went ahead and got a pizza. What a horrible first impression. Burnt on the bottom, under baked and soggy. Too many toppings on one side of the pizza. It only took 30 mins to get, maybe you should slow down and pay closer attention to detail.
author: Serena T.

description:
This place was literally the best fucking pizza I've ever had. Stumbled in with my girlfriend after a night of drinking and was completely blown away by my tikka masala pizza, YES TIKKA MASALA ON A PIZZA IS A THING AND ITS GLORIOUS. 

A million stars for this gem.
author: Mia G.

description: This pizza is amazing! I got a slice of the veggie deluxe and chicken tikka. Loved the veggie deluxe - it was the best I've ever had, so many amazing veggies. Choke. Tikka was great too but too heavy for me by I can see how people love it!
author: Lena T.

description: This is one of the crappiest places to order pizza on a weekend. Maybe it's better on the weekdays. I get it not all cooks are consistent. The food was burnt, soggy, warm, the plastic table that keeps cheese from sticking on the box poked wholes at the bottom of the box!!! The pesto cheese bread was awful & burnt & just looked like you should not eat it. The dude who delivered looked at me crazy cuz I didn't tip but it took more than an hour for them to bring me terrible food & I regret the tip I already paid on yelp.
author: Sarah V.

description:
Hello writing this review so everyone who has rated it 1 star should get checked for either having bad taste buds or they think that they are entitled to everything. 

Traveled from Sacramento and wanted to try some authentic pizza and it was very good.. I don't care if you take my comment/review into consideration. My family and I loved it.. .. Thank you brothers pizza!
author: Jamie C.

description:
My boyfriend ordered Brothers pizza for delivery. I never liked Brothers but I was hoping this time it would be better. I LOVE pizza and I would never turn down a slice of hot cheesy pizza. But Brothers is just gross. The cheese has no flavor and the worst part is the bread...it's sooo thick and soggy! It's like eating bread. I don't know about you but I like my pizza to be thin crusted and covered with melting cheese (but not soggy). I took 2 bites out of the pizza and couldn't eat anymore of it. I gave the rest to my dogs...of course, they loved it (lol). 
Round Table is even better then this place!
author: Em Z.

description: To start I know it says Brothers Pizza, but we love the Indian food.  Nothing fancy but the flavor is there.  Chicken Tikka or Marsla.  We love both.  My last time down to San Francisco a friend bought me a Chicken Tikka Pizza... love it.  Nothing fancy .... but good food.  I also love the Mango Lassa.
author: India G.

description: I had the worst experience ordering a medium pizza to go on Saturday night. We went there for convenience. It would have been better to throw our $18 out the window. It was a soggy sloppy inedible pizza. Terrible ingredients and the sauce was like water. Our box was soaked before we got it home. I never use yelp because I'm in the service industry and am cautious to critique. Yet I have to let others know that don't waste your money like we did. They need to change something here or only charge $5 a pizza so you know what to expect.
author: Jessica S.

description: Nice people own this place.  The pizza is super delicious, fast delivery, and they also have great food, other than pizza.  I've enjoyed their Indian food; paneer something..., and lasagne.  All good!
author: Marvella W.

description: First experience here was not great, but I've since been a few more times and their chicken tikka masala pizza is quite interesting.
author: Tony P.

description:
Called, didn't even say anything and I was placed on hold right away. Ordered  a medium Hawaiian pizza and added garlic. $19.30

-1, a whole lot of crust and it taste like nothing. I mean don't get me wrong, there is suppose to have crush in pizza but there's no taste.....

-1, a whole lot of cheese than ham, pineapple, and garlic 

1-, price, wasn't worth it. 

I feel like it's a hit or miss here.
author: Jasmin T.

description:
Terrible.  They used to be good.  They messed up my last 3 orders, and this last order was horrible, with a soggy inedible pizza.  I called them and requested them to remove me from their computer system; they were happy to do so.  They do not care about me, as a customer.

... And their pizza sucks now, and service.  Oh well.
author: Timotheus C.

description: My first order here was a veggie sandwich. It was disgusting even though I hadn't  ate all day. I swallowed my pride and politely asked for a different item (Indian veggie pizza recommended by a friend). The girl at the counter gave me an AMAZINGLY GREAT PIZZA SLICE a few minutes later without any attitude and a sense of understanding. Now I order an entire pizza every time and always over eat because my goodness it's great!
author: Valerie E.

description: Put in an online order and it was quick and easy. Lot of food for a good value. Wings are actually pretty damn good! And of course the single slice pizza is HUGE! Big plus. All in all I'm satisfied
author: Tiff H.

description: love that quick hot late night pie!
author: Fernando F.

description: I said before that the pizza is pretty good and the Indian food is pretty good, but I didn't mention the lasagna, given that I hadn't tried it. How is it? Pretty good, and enormous. Not "oh my gosh, you gotta try this!", but definitely not disappointed, which is far from a given when ordering lasagna from a pizza joint. And of course they remain both quick and really nice. Plus, that section of Taraval near the beach is livening up again.
author: Nathan P.

description:
Ordered delivery from here on Sunday 4/12/15. Delivery person followed directions to call and not ring the doorbell, so I thought great, I will order from this place again.

Ordered delivery on Tuesday 4/14/15. Delivery person rang the doorbell and did not bother to call, like I requested. Due to this, I will be trying someplace else next time.

Some people put their phone on vibrate because other people live there and will wake up. Some people have roommates. Some people have babies. Some people have pets. Don't ring the doorbell if someone states don't ring the doorbell. Thanks.

Regarding the food itself, their pasta dishes are good. Chocolate mousse cake is good. Naan and bread are horrible.
author: Wendy L.

description: Got wings and the green and white pizza. Wings were chewy soggy. The pizza toppings were grossly  overcooked to the point of brown goo and the crust was hard and chewy.
author: Michael A.

description: I would give them a five star score because I love their Indian Vegetarian Pizza. It is the absolute best. I've ordered it so much, and I never get tired of it. The reason why their getting a 2 star is because of the nasty service I received when I ordered pizza for delivery. I was told that I was too far for delivery (I was actually at school, which is a shorter distance to my home where they have delivered numerous times). The guy on the phone was so rude and nonchalant in regards to my order, and the unwillingness to be flexible and lack of professionalism, they will never receive a dime from me again.
author: Tyree R.

description: Delivery took longer than expected. Pizza was good, but wasn't cut all the way and had to recut almost every piece again. Couple of hours later I got hit with food poisoning. My stomach is typically susceptible to unfortunate events, but after consulting with my friends, turns out some (not all) of them weren't feeling too well the next morning either though they didn't get as sick as I did.
author: Shirlene L.

description: Ordered raviolis on Eat24, but got spaghetti. Not sure how that happened when it's written in black and white on the order. The spaghetti is overdone and I'm probably just gonna chuck it... super bummed. At least Eat24 is giving me a refund, but I'm still craving raviolis. :/
author: Melissa C.

description:
Warning!!!! Do not order Pizza from this business ever!
This evening I received two X-Large pizzas, one garlic and black olive, and a pepperoni and sausage that arrived from a driver who must have slammed the brakes at every stop sign on my route. The toppings, sauce, cheese on both pizzas had oozed, leaving naked crust over 1/3 of the garlic and olive pie and left a large mess of goo in the box, rendering about half of the pizza edible. The sausage and pepperoni pizza did not fair much better. Most of the pizza slid off base crust into the box, leaving me to get a large kitchen spoon to back scoop it back on part of the crust, because my youngest had just finished a soccer match, and was "starving".

I called immediately back to Brothers, speaking to guy who I ordered from, asking for a cell number so I could send pictures of both pizzas, so I could get refunds if asked about the pizzas later. The person on the phone said he was too busy too talk, but that I would get a pie on the house, and they would get back to me when it calmed down. Later they texted me saying they wanted a "whole picture of the garlic and olive pizza". I sent a text back saying I sent you one, only to be told that it wasn't a the entire box. I asked if there was a problem.

I called back then the owner got on the phone. If you ever have to deal with this guy, don't. He told me he would offer me 20% off my next order. I explained that the person on the phone quoted me at least one free pie because of the shape that my pizzas arrived in. He said that he was the owner, take it or leave it.

I spent almost $50 on two pies that arrived in garbage shape, called back immediately, i would have loved for them to cook me up two new ones, not offered, too busy, then sent them good quality pictures to show how incredibly poor quality the pizzas arrived in, only to be told that I did not take a large enough photo of the outside of the box, then, my next free pizza was taken away, to be offered a whopping 20% discount on my next purchase! Yeah right, my next pizza purchase will not be made through Brothers Pizza, that is for sure! Good riddance, look it up!
author: MacGarrett F.

description: Coming from NY I definitely have a high standard for pizza. These pizza slices are huge definitely. They have a wide variety of styles. I was surprised to see a chicken marsala pizza and tandoori chicken. The slices sometimes fall apart, but I just end up eating them with knife and fork. Overall average pizza when you have a hankering for pizza.
author: Gaby E.

description: I'm a simple girl. I like simple pizza. Just a freshly made artichoke and mushroom pizza. And it's always made the same way. So we will always keep coming back. Been coming here since I was a teenager and now my teenager loves coming here.
author: Anna M.

description:
WARNING: Disgusting. Never in my life have I thrown an entire pizza, fresh out of the box, into the trash.

I was a longtime customer of this place, but not after this last order. Maybe it was an "off night"? I don't give a shit, you should be ashamed putting your name on a product as disgusting as this. The pizza that arrived looked like someone had poured a glass of watery grease on top of the cheese, and the sausage was RAW. I won't miss your bad food, but I hope you guys miss my regular orders.
author: Rob B.

description: Would like to tell you that this place is the best pizza joint in the sunset great pizza and great servic. Would definitely recommend this to all the friends and family.
author: Vlad V.

description: Love this pizza. Delivery is fast. Cheese is yummy and crust is always delicious. Great for mid week family crunch dinner.  I appreciate that they know my order by heart. Always respectful delivery people. Pizza is just really really good. Been there forever so they have practice!
author: Monique P.

description: They deserve another star for being consistent after all these years and still delivering a hot, chewy, crusty, cheesy, pizza; super-fast. Plus, they have the best ranch dressing, eva.
author: Laurie A.

description: My go to spot after trying most of the neighborhood pizza joints. Their pizza is tasty, the staff and owner are friendly, and the prices are reasonable. We ordered normal pizzas for the past year or so, but recently got hooked on their tandoori chicken pizzas. Pro tip: go for a half and half chicken Tikka and tandoori chicken pizza. My wife prefers the Tikka, I prefer tandoori. The owner is there most of the time and always seems appreciative of  customers. If you're looking for snobby pizza to share with your hipster friends on Instagram, or a charming cafe with high-end decor, you may want to look elsewhere, but if you're looking for a solid family-owned pizza neighborhood pizza spot, give it a shot.
author: Timothy G.

description:
Used to order from this place often, their tandori wings were popular with my husband. Tonight, we ordered tandori wings and a small pizza. It came up to $30 
We were dissappointed with the quality. Wings were mostly chicken skin and made them seem very gooey.
Pizza was so so oily, and soggy. Will not order from them anymore. Order was delivered one hour and 15 min after ordering.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description: Myself and two friends came up to SF from Sacramento & the only spot for pizza they said would be this pizza joint so I said let's check it out. We have places in sacramento but Hari gave quick service and the pizza was out of the oven before I knew it. Perfect pizza couldn't ask for more!
author: Geronimo W.

description:
You don't go here for customer service or to sit in a fancy restaurant , you go here for the delicious mouth watering PIZZA. I've been going to this place for sometime now. They never acknowledge you or care that you drive an hour and 15 minutes to eat here. I love good customer service but I make the exception for this place because their food is fantastic and it's walking distance to Ocean Beach. 

Lets talk about their menu! 

Like I said I've been going here for 12 years now (even when I didn't live in Bay Area I would stop by here every chance I got) 

Every time I've been here the cooks have always been Indian . Their menu is traditional Italian with a twist of Indian infused flavors, along with a traditional Indian menu. 

You have your traditional Italian flavors , food and pizza like the meat lovers called the Brothers Pizza, veggie pizza, spaghetti and fettuccine however then they have these amazing flavorful random pizzas that are completely 5 STARS with good quality ingredients. 

I don't know the history behind this place and how they know how to make such amazing Italian food along with Indian food but it sure is good! The employees lack interpersonal skill and they are not very approachable to actually strike a conversation and find out the history but I've always been curious. 

Some of the pizzas I've tired and absolutely love .

*Tandoori Chicken Pizza -
Chicken breast marinated in Indian spices, cilantro (yogurt, garlic, ginger, lime juice, cumin and cayenne) and mozzarella cheese. (5 Stars) 

*Chicken Tikka Masala Pizza  - 
Garam masala, spiced tandoori roasted boneless chicken breast and mozzarella cheese. (BEST) (5 Stars) 

* Indian Style Vegetarian Pizza -
Spinach, broccoli, sun dried tomatoes, garlic, mozzarella cheese and Indian gravy.

*Seafood Pizza -
Shrimp, roasted garlic, clams and mozzarella cheese.

They also have a Tandoor Clay Oven so they make the traditional Indian dishes as well . They had this tandoor sandwich I had one time under daily specials,  it was so flavorful and the best Indian style sandwich I ever had . 

The Italian food bursts in traditional Italian flavors. You can taste the oregano, parsley,  garlic, thyme and all the flavors that make a good Italian dish. This place is always generous with the spices and ingredients. As far as their Italian food , I've had the fettuccine and eggplant parmesan. You can taste how fresh the eggplant is. So good ! 

Side Notes :

* they make everything fresh to order , so yes there will be a wait 

* hole in the wall , tiny not so clean looking place 

* they have a few tables but majority of the time it's full 

* I always place my order 30 mins before arriving, regardless if I'm eating there or getting it to go. 

* waking distance to ocean beach 

* sometimes I take it to go and we eat at the beach , if your doing this , take hand sanitizer, bunch of napkins , ask them for paper plates and plastic silverware. Be prepared , ocean beach is windy !!! 

* they are not customer service oriented , your not going here for customer service  , your going here for the food. I have accepted they are not very customer service oriented. 

* super casual , leave the Jimmy Choo's and Louboutins at home . Again whole in the wall.
author: Regina S.

description: I bought an XL pizza from here, which was half chicken tikka masala and half all meat pizza. This costed me over $30 and was one of the worse pizzas I have ever had. The crust was way too thick and also uneven. The meat was severely lacking especially when it costs more than $30. The meat was also quite bland and the pizza was lacking sauce. Id highly recommend Seniore's over this place. Decided to give this place a chance once and I will never be coming back.
author: Andy Z.

description: This is my favorite pizza place they got great pizza deals great for watching the game
author: Remysbarbie M.

description: Some of their stuff is good but be careful with their sketchy staff. My friend and I are not from that area but were out on a day of fun and decided to grab some grub. The girl at the front rang him up to 20.64$. He comes back to the table and realizes he is $5 short since he thought she said 26$. He confronted the girl but she denied it. In the end she ripped him off 5$ simply because he had misheard her. On top of that, it was the worst pizza my good friend has eaten.
author: Mari V.

description: We ordered a Spaghetti and Meat Sauce Dinner, a Brother's Special Pizza, 2 desserts, and a 2 liter of root beer. They left out the salad for the dinner and our 2 liter was room temperature. They were fast with the delivery, but they shorted us the salad. We will order a la cart instead, if there will be a next time.
author: Karena C.

description: I ordered a large beef and mushroom with extra cheese to be delivered. I don't know if the delivery guy drove through a construction site before going through the rockiest terrain available to get to me but my pizza toppings were only on one side of the pizza  since all of it oozed to the right.  Yes I still ate it... Well...the one side with all the cheese and  toppings... It saved me on overloading the carbs... Thanks for watching my weight brothers pizza... Next time I'll order a coke with it... Cus I'm pretty sure it'll be shaken up and when I open it,  half of it will explode in my face... But the pizza with half the toppings was good...
author: Hsi N.

description:
Ya brah.

Some of my least favorite people: http://www.urbandictionary.com/define.php?term=bros

One of my most favorite sandwiches: An epic and delicious pile of BBQ chicken, pizza sauce and onions on a roll. Comes with cheese too. All for $6 and change.

So big you can make that two of my most favorite sandwiches.
author: Jason B.

description:
Brothers Pizza - Cheesy Goodness, Slice by Slice.

Hidden amidst a small block on Taraval, Brother's pizza is definitely a great place to go to.
Slices are enormous with toppings stacked for just 5 dollars.
It can smell sometimes and some places within the pizzeria are quite dirty.

The cashiers and servers are eh, not really the nicest and most welcoming ones, but it does not matter as long as they get your order down.

Overall, a great place to get some take-out if you're nearby, or even chill inside where it's all cozy while watching the current 49ers or Warriors game.
author: Jeffy Y.

description: This place is awesome the pizza is the best in sunset. The pizza cooks are the best, the customer service is wonderful. Well go there again for sure....
author: John S.

description: I'm torn.  The pizza is really good, but everything else is really bad. I ordered a hot sandwich, chicken nuggets, fries, jalapeño poppers and a pizza. The pizza was the only thing that was edible.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Wow the owner there is so damn arrogant, this place needs new life and inspiration. 

I've been there about a dozen times now since 2010. The pizza quality has gone down since then. I have always gotten very thin dough that is the floopy, floppy kind and I kindly asked them to make it a bit thicker. They took offense like immature children and decided to not make the pizza as I had asked.

What I got was the pizza dough that was about 4 to 5 times as thick, thicker than any I've ever had, and I could not even eat a few slices. I ended up just picking of the cheese and toppings and throwing away the undercooked raw dough. 

The owner is the face of arrogance and does not have maturity. The owner acts as if it's beneath him to take a request and listen to his customers. Well, I don't think you'll be getting a "best pizza" award anytime soon like the one that's been collecting dust on the wall.
author: Jason M.

description: I have visited many times over the years. Fair prices, nice staff, and very good pizza (I usually get the tandoori chicken pizza).
author: Jethro B.

description: Been going here for 21 years. Grew up on this pizza since a little girl. The plain cheese and chicken tandoori pizza is amazing! Everyone who've I've introduced those two types loved it and keep going back. Their garden salad is bomb too :)
author: Monica L.

description:
Great customer service, nice people. 
I wish I could give half stars because this place is closer to a 2 1/2 than 2. 
I've been twice. First time I got the tikka masala pizza and indian vegetarian, both very tasty and worth going back for. This time I got the chicken tikka masala dinner with rice, added garlic nan and dal. So the dal was eh-aite. Not bad, but bland. The garlic nan while having some visible garlic on it had no garlic taste and seemed like the pizza dough served as nan(as pizza its great, as nan...eh-aite). I got to the tikka masala and it was terrible(for tikka masala). Tasted like pizza sauce with some chucks of chicken in it. I'm pretty forgiving as a foodie, every kitchen has an off night. I called the restaurant asked if maybe I'd gotten the wrong order, confirmed it was the right order, so I asked if I could bring it back. By the time I got there the cook had tried the tikka sauce and confirmed it was unintentionally extra-tomato-y, offered to make me something else(I passed) and gave me a refund. I decided to eat the rice that came with the order when I got home and call it a night, because while still kinda hungry I wasn't really hungry enough to order take out from a whole new place. 

I open the rice and laying right on top is a very very long hair. Like from someone with shoulder length hair. Threw everything away. 

Like I said, great people, food the last time was great, every kitchen has an off night, I'll probably try these guys again...but damn I was excited about my tikka masala.
author: Alize A.

description:
For the record, I've never been one to take the time out of my day to write reviews. Especially not negative ones, and especially not reviews about food. However Brothers Pizza is a special case, in that their pizza has remained extraordinary since i moved-in around the corner 6 months ago. Honestly, great pizza, great pasta, interesting menu decent prices, etc. etc. 
Yet the MANIC DEPRESSIVE Asian girl answering phones and working the register, is hands down the most un-friendly, and at times downright rude character in my life right now. I've stopped tipping her and trying to be kind months ago. My roommates and neighbors have had the same experience, and if it wasn't one of three options within walking distance, I'd probably never return based on the service alone. This girl should be on suicide-watch, not interacting with (and likely deterring) customers.
author: Sam L.

description: I used to come here quite often for a quick sandwhich pizza. Their sausage pizza sandwhich is good. Its big and has just the right amount of cheese. I like the bread they use, its chewy and fresh. As for the guy behind the counter. well, he is cool if you go there alot.  I think he's just like that...in general. I don't know him but I think he's always like that. I just have a feeling. But, like i said if you go there enough you sometimes see he's actually not a bad person.
author: Selby C.

description:
The slices are awesome. For some reason, the slices are always better than the whole pies.
They need to slice their toppings, instead of wantonly throwing whole half peppers and onions onto the pizza. But overall the pizza is really good. 
The most salient comment I have is the front service is provided by a young, rude, unfriendly, unhappy, miserable girl, who puts the very nice and professional owners to shame with her total bitch attitude. The adults who run this restaurant are completely undermined by this little bitch. I do not understand why they allow her to represent this otherwise stable, awesome pizza place. 
Please give this little snothead her performance review, And then kindly fire her.
author: Patrick S.

description: Huge slices. Really good crust not to thick not to thin. have a beer at the Riptide next door.
author: Matt H.

description: I got excited that they have Indian/Pakistani pizzas. But I'd suggest leaving your appetite for a trip to Fremont. Here, the service is disgruntled, which translates to rude. The pizzas are slow, especially if you are looking for a quick slice. The slices themselves are giant, which justifies the $5 per specialty slice. I was shocked at first, but rest assured that you will get a generous serving. In fact, maybe too generous? That cheese is just too much. No browning, just gooey. I don't understand how it could resemble pale nacho cheese on my plate. The tandoori chicken pizza looked toxic because the chicken was far too brightly red, which makes me think food coloring instead of spices. The chicken tikka was good and I did taste a great deal of tumeric. Coolest thing about this place was the black and white photos of San Francisco on the walls.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Brothers is not fancy, but they do make a decent Pizza , and they have great online deals that make them one of the most affordable Pizzas in SF , 
For me its a good option when I don't want to cook and don't mind having Pizza  for 2 days !
author: Joseph A.

description: The dough is like a pizza pita Naan fusion. Super fluffy yet not over the top bread-y. Generous amounts of cheese, chicken pesto on point, and Italian/clay oven entrees also. Nice friendly family run spot. Personally I'd say stick with the pizza menu but that's because I prefer Pakistani over Indian and is hard to run a pizza shop that sells clay oven without fusing too many of the ingredients with Italian and vice versa. Out of all pizza in the area, I truly believe this one reigns king for the quality of their ingredients relative to the surrounding pizza joints... eat here!
author: Shaun C.

description:
I mean the workers don't seem happy to be there, but the pizza is still delicious! A big oily. Never ordered any pastas though. 

It's perfect if you wanna eat pizza at the beach or want to order a huge slice. There are TVs and the building is small.
author: Jade F.

description:
A French/German girl and an Irishman ordered Indian food from an Asian man at a pizza place.  And it worked out wonderfully.

Except for the naan. Skip the naan.
author: Meg W.

description:
Do not order from here unless you live on the ground floor. 

It's great that they are giving senior citizens an opportunity to work but the owner/manager needs to change this guy's position to something more sedentary. He either A.) Did not want to climb up the 3 flights of stairs so he kept ringing the doorbell to get me to come down to the street. Or B.) Did not realize that the gate was already open. He had the gate open when I got down there. Either way, this is unacceptable. I had to leave my sleeping baby all alone while I literally ran downstairs to find out why this guy wasn't coming up and to get him to stop ringing the doorbell (again, sleeping baby!!). 

I was going to just let it go and never order from here again but I decided to write this review once I realized that I burned my arm carrying the pizza upstairs. There's a painful, red mark on my arm! The pizza box was caving in so I had to put my arm underneath to brace it. Obviously I held it by the sides at first but I didn't want to drop my pizza all over the stairs once the box started caving in. 

Thanks for the second degree burn and for stressing me out because I had to leave my child alone. Never again.
author: J R.

description:
These guys are great at making individual slices. If you ask them to make a whole pizza though it's a gamble. It could either be terribly assembled or reasonably assembled. It's not that the pizza is bad, it's just that they don't know how to construct it properly. Here are a few ways you could improve it : 

1. Make your toppings smaller so you can better distribute them throughout the pizza. Each individual topping DOES NOT need to be the size of a thumb or larger. Maybe cut it down to 1/4 of that size. This also prevents the situation where you pull half of the cheese off the slice when you bite into it.  

2. Don't put so many toppings on the pizza. Especially when there are 2 or more toppings. Figure out a nice balance for the toppings. You don't want the pizza to be too top heavy. Also, too many meat toppings adds to the grease factor, which makes the center of the pie soggy and difficult to hold/eat. 

3. Put some freakin' sauce on the pizza! It's not just you, nobody knows how to do this. 
It's pizza, not cheese bread.

4. Slice a full pie into reasonably slices. I can understand an individual slice being larger than normal. But that doesn't mean the full pie slices need to be the same size. I would say, cut each slice once more down the middle. 

5. This might be a hard one. But if you can figure out a way to cook the pizza so that you can pick up a WHOLE individual slice from the pie without leaving most of the center end in the box, that would be great.  

Homework :  

Re-evaluate the construction of your full pizzas. I will check back in a month. Make me proud.
author: Hank K.

description: Service for delivery was very good fast and the pizza was hot. But the pizza was a bit soggy and everything fell off the bread and was very difficult to eat the pizza. I had s combo but they cooked the cheese on top it wasn't very good.
author: Irving S.

description: Best pizza in the sunset! I always get the pesto one, i love it. I also recommend the one with different kind of meat (i forgot how it's called!)
author: Eve H.

description: Really good pizza. They make it fresh to order. Been ordering their pizza since I was a kid. Only thing is that if you order take out, by the time you get to eat the pizza, the dough is all soggy (especially in the middle of the pizza). However, the crust is good and is not soggy. Location in the outer Sunset makes it a bit of a drive for me but if I'm in the area, I would go there more often.
author: Ray S.

description: Ordered through eat24, very fast delivery. I got the ravioli with meat sauce. It was pretty good and it came with this tasty salad. Deff will order from here again :)
author: Annabelle S.

description:
Got the Indian pizza and the basic daal, rice combination. We're know a little about Indian food (unfortunately for this place) and turmeric, in our limited experience, should be used sparingly, as a spice. However in this case (esp. In the daal), that seemed to the main ingredient! I'm still working to remove the turmeric stain from our table where we had a little spil!

Maybe we ordered the two wrong items on the menu  as there seem to be an abundance of positive reviews for this place. But do I have to take another chance? Maybe not...
author: Rajesh R.

description: I order from this place for about 3 years and I recently found out they have been using less dough on the pizza than the previous year. Once you order a whole pizza, you get all the fat drench into the middle making the dough soggy and disgusting.
author: Simon H.

description: To be honest the pizza wasn't anything too special, it was just average, but the service was good. The Girl at the front counter was very friendly and it made my experience all the better.
author: Emily G.

description: I've been eating here for 28 years. Brother's is a tiny place in a quiet residential neighborhood with pictures of Old San Francisco across the walls. They still make the biggest and tastiest pizzas I have ever had. I learned to love pesto here when I was a teenager. I now live 40 miles south of Brother's Pizza, but I eat here whenever I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Shawnie C.

description: Go to place when I have no idea what to eat. I must say their Indian food is decent but portion was a fail. I tried most of their appetizers, the Stuffed Jalapenos was ok, cheese sticks tastes like string cheese covered with breading, chicken nuggets does not taste like chicken.. BUT their wings are hella good! I highly recommend it. As for the pizza, I will find out soon.
author: Moi R.

description:
I've always admired the work of some of the greatest artists way before our time.  A few of them particularly stood out to me amongst the many.  There was Raphael whose most famous work was frescoed on the walls of some Vatican rooms known as 'The school of Athens'.  Then there was Raphael's rival Michaelangelo known for his famous sculptures of David and Pietà.  Also Leonardo, the creator of the masterful piece, Mona LIsa, known for its striking realism at that time, which eventually set the standard to portrait painting thereafter.   We can't forget about Donatello, with his famous sculptures that highlighted human naturalism.

They were all Italians from the renaissance period who expressed their thoughts and ideas through painting and sculpting.  Italians... how fitting for a pizza review right?  I love how art can speak to us about their masters and their time of existence very much like the way food does.  Pizza itself can be an art, some would surely agree, but the pizza that painted my heart of utter love for mozzarella didn't come until I was around 7.  Somehow, the 4 great artists I mentioned, reincarnated themselves into turtles.  Yes... turtles.  Green turtles... born, mutated, and raised in NYC by a rat who went by the name of Splinter.  Although born as Americans in their new reincarnated lives, a part of Leonardo, Raphael, Michelangelo, and Donatello stayed Italian.  They not only painted and sculpted much of my childhood which inspired me to learn ninja skills, fight evil, do good, and grow a shell on my back... but they also created my undying love for cheese and pizza.  After developing and maturing my mutated cravings for pizza, I was so lucky to have Brothers Pizza just a walk away from my home then.

I knew at a very young age that being a ninja turtle required lots of courage because I found it very scary and difficult to put gummy bears, chocolate, peanut butter, and other weird things on my pizzas.  I thought I started off well as a little kid though.  While other kids were going for the usual boring pepperoni or plain cheese, I went straight for the garlic clams which eventually became my signature move even better than my jump kick.  The guys would've been proud of this young pizza loving ninja.

An extra large garlic clam back in those days went for 9.99.  I'd take 11 bucks from my mom and vanish like a black belt to go pick up my deliciously gooey cheesy ninja life source.  These days it costs just over 30 bucks after tips for delivery but it's just as amazing and stringy with a generous amount of moz like it was over 20 years ago.  My tastes and courage has improved to other things now like a cheesy pesto sun dried tomato mushroom sausage pizza finished off with parmesan and chili flakes... sometimes even dipped in a creamy ranch sauce or a drizzle of Tapatio.  They are still generous with the cheese and toppings after all these years.  

My changing ideals of the perfect pizza really goes to show how time changes everything just like how these Heroes in a Half Shell went from their love of renaissance art to their modern day love of italian pies and fighting crime.

I'm not much of an artist like the 4 of them once were, but I can surely devour a good pizza from Brothers and give my napkins a beautifully abstracted oil painting any day while dishing out high fives as our home teams score.  

Surf's up dudes!  Cowabunga!
author: Colin M.

description:
Delicious pizza, some nice uncommon varieties.

Terse service, almost robotic unfriendliness.

The pizza is almost always too hot to eat without letting it cool for several minutes in the cold SF air.  (The roof of my mouth is still in pain from my first bite three days ago.)
author: Daniel H.

description:
I live around the corner from Brother's, so I always order pick-up or I eat there. And, mind you, I'm not one to complain about food. However, Brother's has lately become exceptionally complaint-worthy. I gave them 3 tries in the last 2 months, and they struck out. I'm sad to say that I probably won't be giving them my business anymore. 

The recent shift in quality has roused my curiosity ... Management shift? Careless late-night staff? Irritating Riptide customers provoking Brother's Pizza to make their product with vengeance? I'd like to know, because there's gotta be a reason why their pizza quality  has changed in the last couple of months, and has become less than satisfactory.

My problem has been that the dough is too soft on the bottom and the crust is overdone. The toppings just sort of cascade off the pizza, so you either fork it or cram it in your mouth like you're trying to hide it. I also feel like many of the toppings have been older, perhaps prepared the day prior. 

Their front counter customer service has always been terrible, which usually doesn't bother me because, in the past, their pizza has typically pretty damn good. I've worked in various areas of food customer service for the last 9 years and no one really wants to smile and greet strangers and feign interest all day long. Some people are better at it, others are not, and the latter category have found work at Brother's.

Perhaps it's because I usually order pizza after 9 or maybe they really just despise making a Hawaiian with jalapeno. Whatever it is, I'm moving on.
author: Kaylene B.

description:
Stopped in here with a friend before heading next door to the Riptide for Karaoke, and...well, it's a mixed bag. To wit:

Pros: Really reasonable, decent prices on a wide variety of interesting food options, small, intimate drop in seating in the shop, good smells and, for the most part, wonderful pizza from the type I tried.

Cons: I don't know if it was just overdone or what, but the pizza crust along the bottom was a bit rough n' tough, and the gal at the front counter had the look of a 15 year old forced to be there who couldn't care less about helping people, and boy did she follow through on that look.

So good food and good prices v. tough crust and cruddy counter person...I'd probably stop in again, if just to experience another pizza off their menu. :)
author: Casey B.

description:
I have been coming to brothers for 20 years and it is still my favorite pizza in the city.
Same two brothers and they have not changed. Quality ingredients and skill makes a great pie.  
There  Indian food is great as well. 
One of the few true SF classic places.
author: Barney B.

description: Ordered for delivery 2.5 hours before for dinner and they were still 40 minutes late. Asked for condiments twice and they never brought them either. The driver then was very pushy for the tip when he arrived; never apologized for being late and not bringing the condiments then pushed for the tip one more time. The stuffed jalapeño appetizer was undercooked and very pale in color. I had to toast it after delivery to a golden brown and delicious exterior before serving. Its sauce was a white cream sauce and nothing like what was in the menu. One disaster after another. I do not recommend this place.
author: Yelp R.

description: This pizza is absolutely awesome!! The crust and the toppings are to die for!! Usually, the crust isn't crispy when it's delivered but not with you guys. You're the best.
author: Michelle P.

description: The pizza is just Awesum  they were really big and tasty plus they also serve some really good Indian food  luv this place
author: Amrutha R.

description: Truly the hidden gem of the Outer Parkside/Sunset area. Not only does this place do great pizza and pasta, but they have really good Indian food too (great chicken tikka masala). Full disclosure: I pretty much ate here 2-3 times a weeks, and was almost never disappointed.
author: Christian S.

description: The pizza is very good and if you like a lot of cheese on your pizza you WON'T be disappointed. The owners are very nice people. The prices are good and they're delivery was very fast. Inside is very basic and relaxed. They do have a TV which is always nice.
author: Evan J.

description: My new favorite pizza place in the Sunset district.  I grew up on Pirro's Pizza and they have gone down hill the past few years, so time for a hunt for a new pizza joint.... This place is killer!!!  The pesto pizza with artichoke hearts is to die for!!!!!  Will be back again soon!!!
author: Kevin W.

description:
The first time I came here, I ordered a whole pizza and the whole thing fell apart! It was too soggy in the center of the pizza and when you would try to grab it, it wasn't even a pizza anymore. Just a mixture of bread, cheese, and other toppings mixed together like fried rice.

The 2nd time I came here, I ordered an individual slice and I must say, it was way better. It holds up well and makes the dish more edible and appetizing. However, I cannot give this more more than a 2 star.

We wanted to get more water and so we went up to the front counter and asked for some more. One of the cooks caught the attention of the front counter guy who was smoking out in the front of the restaurant to get us water. He put his cigarette off to side and came in and poured us a glass of water...WITHOUT WASHING HIS HANDS. It was a deal breaker for me. 1) The cook wasn't doing anything...couldn't he just give us the water? 2) the guy was smoking without washing his hands! I don't want any cigarette residue anywhere near my water. I was disappointed and couldn't get passed it. I didn't finish my pizza and we just left.
author: Michelle K.

description:
"...carbolicious win"

this review should not be more than 2 stars BUUUUUUUUT:

The pizza from brothers is not going to win any awards in the contest with the likes of Pizetta 211, Tonys, Una, or Delfina. The one thing that gives this pizza a fighting chance at not being utterly forgettable is its proximity to the beach. So the 3 stars in this context is a very relative rating - and in an objective world this is a maximum 2 star product - compared to their SF competition.  But the occasional sunset at OB, close to perfect weather, and an IPA (from a liquor store next door) make brothers a "worth your time" destination. Last pizza we got here was a potato pesto with half anchovies - and it was a total carbolicious win - mostly due to the sunset which we proceeded to watch delicious slices in hand (and an IPA in the other hand).
author: Oleg H.

description:
Gotta be honest, I pretty much agree with Kaylene B below. I, too, live right in the area and we've done pick-up twice in the past two months. Interestingly, we ate there once when we moved in back in May, and I do remember it being better. I definitely agree that the difference in doneness between crust and center is a bit annoying, and I like my toppings to have better adherence.

Plus, the counter service can be just really atrocious. Would it kill you to smile or be a little gracious? I don't HAVE to spend my money here, and now that I know there's a (superior) pizza spot up at 19th that is open later, well... maybe I won't let my laziness get the better of me anymore.

Except, well, there is the little matter of the Indian Vegetarian. Yum. The sauce alone is just really amazing - I don't know whether they make it there or not, but it was definitely excellent.
author: Amanda P.

description: Ordered through eat 24 a half an hour before closing. They confirmed my order with Eat 24 but never delivered my order. Maybe since I chose to pay with cash they figured it wouldn't be a big deal to disregard the order and close early.
author: Bryan G.

description: I've had every pizza in the Outer Sunset and upper Peninsula. Brothers has won out as our choice for many years. Solid pies, solid delivery.
author: M. D.

description: Got the chicken tikka masala twice and I must say its really good! I haven't tried the pizza yet, but the Indian food there seems on par with most restaurants in SF, maybe even better! Price is decent as well (9 dollars for the masala and 2 naan) , and the size per entree could fill 2-3 people.
author: Kalima Z.

description:
Really sad to have to give Brothers two stars.  I've been enjoying them for a while now, but after an extremely rude delivery service this evening, I'm afraid I'll be taking my pizza-related business elsewhere.  

Really great pizza, okay other food, all in all 4 or 4.5 stars for the culinary experience.  However this evening after giving the delivery person $20 for an $18 dollar pizza (not the hugest tip in history I admit but certainly not justifiable of rude behavior), he promptly responded with "THAT'S IT?!", grumbled, and shuffled off.  Pretty unacceptable and unprofessional behavior if you ask me.  

Sorry Brothers, it's been real, but I'm going to patronize a business that doesn't belittle it's customers.
author: D F.

description: Ordered the chicken tikka masala. Wasn't my favorite. I think I like Naan N Curry better. I guess I prefer mine a little less tomato-y and more creamy.
author: Aleyna S.

description:
Yelp, you let me down!

I had a mad craving for Indian food and Pizza one night. I read on yelp that the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza was amazing - and I thought - "How perfect! This is just want I wanted"

Disappointed. 

Maybe my expectations were too high, but I wasn't feeling any of it. The pizza was greasy (and not in the delicious pizza sort of way) and the "tikka masala" tasted like gross garlic spread from a can. The pieces of chicken on the pizza were also huge making it difficult to eat. 

The mango lassi - meh. It was sweet but I've had better. 

The delivery took forever! I called and they said the driver should have already been there. He finally gets here and he's this sweet little old Russian man (looked exactly like the old man from the movie UP). He was so kind that I had nearly forgotten he was late, until I started writing this review...and now I feel sort of like I'm going to hell for writing about how late he was in the review...but not guilty enough to not hit "post review"
author: Vanessa T.

description:
This place used to be good, but I don't get what happened this time. I ordered the Brother's Special which they delivered in 25 minutes, but when I opened the box, it did not look appetizing at all. I'll have to second the reviewers who found their pizza to be soggy, but I'm sure the bottom of my pizza was actually soaked in oil because the pizza looks oily and a third of the box is soaked in oil. And since everything was falling apart, we had no choice but to use forks.

I'm not a picky eater when it comes to pizza, I don't care how the crust is done or how much cheese there is or how even the pizza slices are cut. But I don't expect to be stuffing myself with dried clumps of cheese that slide off the pizza without effort. The only part that was good was the soft crust, but I didn't really pay $24 to enjoy the crust. 

Maybe my pizza came from the reject pile or something, I don't know, I just know I won't be touching their pizza for a while. I guess maybe I'll try North Beach Pizza next time, I know their pizzas are better and the toppings are fresh.
author: Cristal G.

description:
Bravo Brothers Pizza. . .Bravo!

Delicious sunset delivered pizza parlor. Brothers doesn't skimp it: ample amounts of toppings, accompanied by bountiful heaps of cheese piled on-top of a crunchy on the outside, fluffy on the inside crust. The ranch is also quit delectable - watery consistency as opposed to thick and the ranch also has great flavor to it - unique and distinct from your typical grocery store or packet ranch.

The pizza sometimes gets a bit soggy if you take too long to eat it - ease of edibility is lacking here in some cases hence the 4 instead of 5 star review. 

Punctual and friendly delivery service, really makes you feel part of the family . . . Even though my brother is late. . .
author: Phil H.

description:
This pizza place is really different from others! Do you like Indian food? Well they got it too! And now it's possible to have tandoori chicken on pizza, which is my favorite! I would for sure recommend for everyone to check it out! It's a great place to get pizza and great Indian food! 
Defiantly a must check, one of a kind pizza place!
author: Roman E.

description:
Impressively simple yet tasty Indian pizza fusion. Great crust, toppings and seasoning combination. Non-existent decor, but super cheap for $4.99 for a huge slice.

The giant tandoori sandwich is bursting with freshly baked chicken, melted cheese, and fresh lettuce and tomatos.  Yum-meh.
author: Anton G.

description:
It seems like a pretty middle-of-the-road type place, we have only eaten here one time while visiting the area. 

We placed an order for pickup as we were staying nearby and it was an easy walk so point for walkability when we were hungry. My husband and I split the chicken tikka masala pizza, an order of the potato wedges with garlic, parsley and cheese, and an antipasto salad with the house italian dressing. 

The pizza was good, lots of toppings, plenty of chicken... I could have used a little more tikka masala but it was still enjoyable. The pizza was nicely cooked and ended up too big to even fit in the box properly but hey, I'll take it. You better be prepared for major garlic breath if you order the potato wedges - I love garlic, like, really love it, but even this was a little potent for me and the leftovers made the fridge stink. I recommend avoiding the salad altogether... it was soggy, iceberg lettuce with a few extra thinly sliced pieces of salami and pepperoni and some cheese product that was pretending to be mozzarella. 

It was fine, it served our needs for a quick, easy, hot meal... nothing to go out of your way for though.
author: Littany W.

description: I used to love brothers pizza, the recent two times ordering delivery the hamburger chunks on the pizza have been smaller and no longer the big pepperoni pieces and the crust has been undercooked a little bit each time. It was my favorite but these recent changes have caused the taste to go down hill on the pizza. Service and delivery time is still great and the lasagna is still good which is why I keep the 3 star review. I hope they go back to how they were because they were the best. Here's to hoping.....
author: Anthony M.

description: Ordered through online and it was fast.But i wish they could supply us some paper plate and napkins. I did requested it on the request.
author: Raymond C.

description:
Thank you, Kaylene B. and Amanda K.! I thought I noticed a change in quality, for the worse, and am glad to hear it confirmed. The pizza used to be amazing, and I really enjoyed the Indian food, as well. But, as you both mentioned, a few months ago I too  noticed that the pizza wasn't as great anymore but just chalked it up to pizza fatigue. 

Where the change stood out for me was with the naan and daal. I don't know much about Indian cuisine, aside from that the food here is probably less than authentic, but I really did enjoy those two items. Then, a few months ago, the daal recipe changed and the naan turned into just baked pizza dough. It was very disappointed, but somewhat relieved to have my pizza suspicions presumably confirmed. 

I order Brothers through GrubHub and this change occurred right when they started charging for delivery. So, food quality goes down AND delivery is no longer free? These changes together make me think they changed owners or management. I longer order as much from here. Its too bad because what they had really was something special.

3 stars for nostalgia (wouldve been 4 with the old recipes).
author: Jay P.

description: The worth place I have ever ordered food.  They delivered my order in 2 hours!!!!!!! Besides, I got not complete order. A part of my order was not delivered!!! The naan was hard and seemed not fresh. The chicken was dry and not tasty.
author: Anastacia D.

description:
You'd think that two things you love would be ever more aweome-er-er combined, but no.

The Tiki Marsala here is decent, not the best i've had but decent.
Same with the pizza.  SF has so many great pizza joints, but their pizzas are passable.

I ordered (delivery):
-the chicken Tiki Marsala pizza which wasn't all that great.  The crust being soggy is what made this extra disappointing.
-the potato pizza which my friends really enjoyed, but i though was too heavy and starchy.

i ordered (sit down) on another occasion:
-Chicken Tiki Marsala- Not bad, but quite extraordinary.
-Nan- Pretty good, ours was really fresh
-Pesto Special Pizza-  Again, kind of your average pizza.

The sit down food was okay but the delivered pizza was soggy and and has a kind of rubbery consistency.

I wouldn't necessarily recommend this place, but if you have to give it a try, I have two suggestions:
1) Eat there, the quality is worlds apart from the delivery.
2) If you get a pizza, get a traditional flavor, if you get Indian food, get it in it's traditional form.  They're not like Voltron and don't go well together...
author: Anthony L.

description: Wow that was the biggest piece of pizza I have ever eaten in my entire life! I was surprised how expensive it was and then I saw the slice and decided OKAY I'M GOING TO THE BEACH WITH MY PERSONAL PIZZA! I like that it's made to order.
