I don't think the base price for the massive cheese slice is warranted. Friday night pizza and wine at the beach from "Brothers Pizza Try Our Indian Food" is pretty great.
author: Megan S.

description: not suitable for children or the elderly...unless you want your children or good ol' grandmother or grandfather to live past the next day, i highly recommend staying away from the cheese pizza. THE NINJA TURTLES WOULDN'T EVEN EAT THIS CRAP.
author: Pizza M.

description: most unfriendly staff I've ever met. The girl there gave me so much attitude. And my pizza was disgusting. I didn't get through half of it before I threw it away. They do have other good pizzas there but for me it's not even worth it. Go to the pizza place on 45th and noriega...theres is way better and a 10 min walk down the road. :)
author: Eve F.

description: We were heading to Ocean Beach for the day and decided we wanted some pizza. We had the Hawaiian pizza and absolutely loved it!
author: Trini H.

description:
Fast delivery
Great price
Very decent Indian food
Juicy meat ball sandwich. Order it with no lettuce or tomato. Add jalapeño for some kick.
author: Billy T.

description:
Pizza.. Indian.. wait, did a new owner buy the place?  

I first had Brothers when I was a kid, and I still come here occasionally when I'm in the City.  I noticed that there's now Indian food on the menu.  Interesting, never noticed that there.. but the pizza was great as a kid, and still great 15-20 years later.  Their pizzas tend to be on the pricey side, but well worth it!  

Thank you Yelpers for telling me there's a Tikka Masala pizza!  Definitely going to try it the next time I'm back home.
author: Wayland L.

description: Their slices are pretty good.  Worth going if you find yourself in the neighborhood.
author: Zoran L.

description: My go to place for the best sausage!  I've been going here for 25 years?  Spotless but not fancy ....
author: Carrie N.

description:
There aren't too many options in terms of food if you live in the Outer Sunset near the beach, so the presence of Brothers Pizza just gives it an extra star. I used to come here on a daily basis when I didn't have a car and wanted some quick lunch or dinner around the block and Brothers was always me and my sister's favorite option. 

The restaurant is very typical of a pizza restaurant, small and nothing too spectacular. There really isn't much of a decor but just tables and I believe a television. It's not really a place where you come and eat in but you either get it delivered or pickup and leave. But it's never failed me in terms of quality and quantity. The pizza is pretty good (not the best pizza of course) and the slices are usually very big (from what I remember) and it only costs about $2-$3/slice.

The staff there is very nice and friendly. Service is quick and prompt. You want food...you order food...you get it...out the door. Quick and simple.
author: David W.

description:
Honestly the pizza here is actually good and very generous in toppings and the price was unbelieveable

But with all that said, the SERVICE was so disgustly disrespectful and the stupid Chinese kid behind the counter was a complete joke that when we brought the pizza home, I ate one slice and my appetite just went down the drain because of how effin furious I was with the attitude the Chinese snot and his Indian owners/pizza maker gave me 

The entire time my issue was 'Hey this does not look like a combination pizza, the top was all covered with salami and pepperoni and sausage but no veggies'

The Chinese snot ignored my questioning of the pizza and just insisted with complete disreguard to the fact 'hey maybe I'm NOT a regular customer and hey maybe NORMAL combo pizzas DO NOT look like this'

And he proceeded to ring me up with no explanation of why this meat pizza isn't the combo my dad ordered

I said to him twice 'can u just add more olives to the top?'

He ignored me both times and as he stood there waiting for my dad to pay his ungrateful pain in the rear, I leaned over and stared at the indian guy and said 'seriously, can u just add more olives?' 

You would think that being a owner would make the man a little more customer service friendly

NO he grabbed the pizza and just said '5 minutes' 

Still can't believe my dad was willing to pay after that

I explained it to my dad in Chinese to just order their Number 7 pizza next time cuz it stated that one has veggies and the Chinese snot finally busted in with his Chinese 'the veggies are under the cheese'

HOW THE BLOODY HELL WAS I SUPPOSE TO KNOW YOU SELF LOATHING PIECE OF COW DUNG

I'd rather pay TWICE the cost and drive across town and wait inline for Little Star Pizza
author: Droolie Y.

description: I want to like this place, but the pizza is just not good. Something off with the cheese.
author: L M.

description:
LUV LUV LUV Brothers Pizza!  I live in the East Bay and whenever I'm in the area I HAVE to stop by this joint!!

The owner and the pizza cook are so nice and friendly.  I was there only a handful of times when one day the owner recognized me and automatically gave me a discount.  I always get the pepperoni/sausage/olive pie, and the amount of sausage is BEYOND generous!  

I wish there's a pizza joint like this one near where I live.....I just cannot go back to eating Dominos or Round Table or Cybelle's anymore!
author: Ima F.

description:
Delivery was FAST, pizza was good, but not as good as if I had picked it up because it was a little soft/soggy in one place because of the grease. 

However I like their pizza and it must have only taken 25 minutes to get here. Delivery guy was nice. Toppings were generous.
author: Chris I.

description:
Chicken Tikka Pizza is to die for! Their chicken wings however suck! If you stick to their Pizza / Indian menu you can't go wrong.

Also all the crust is hand tossed!
author: Robert P.

description: Large single slice pizza, very cheesey and delicious.  Gigantic calzone (medium size could feed at least 2)  Divey dining room with seating for about 20.  Obviously most customers order take out or delivery.  Of concern was the filthy floor, especially in the corners and under their little kegerator.  Scary Ewwe!  Tighen up on your cleanliness please!!!
author: Kathy P.

description: From time to time I order from brothers. Just cuz I know the pizza is ok and usually the wait is minimal. Just average to below average pizza with thick dough. I sat in last night to have a few slices cuz a neighboring pizza joint was jam packed. The quality has gone down a lot and the slices were tasteless. This visit made me decide to never have pizza here again.  I swear franchised pizza taste better. Pineapple and ham was just thrown on the top and didn't blend with the pizza. Oh it was also dry :( no more.
author: Larry L.

description:
Fair pizza at normal or slightly above normal pricing. Not bad, but our crust was a bit soggy, but the. There were a lot of toppings.

So, middle-of-the-road rating overall.
author: Ghengis G.

description:
This place received some glowing reviews from Yelp as well as folks I've talked to.  But...

Soggy Pizza?  -- Check
Shitty service from the Asian guy at the counter --- Check
Overcharge for pizza --Check

The atmosphere here is quite depressing.  The Asian guy need to change his attitude.  We ordered the Chef's Special (All meat) X-Large for $27.XX.  There was suppose to be a 10% discount which was confirmed over the phone but we never received it.  They do pile on the cheese but I wish I could say the same about their toppings.  A bit skimpy considering the price point.  I cant believe I traveled across town to this place when I could've gotten a decent pie at Bravo's. 

Oh by the way we never received any grated Parmesan.  I had to ask for it.  When I did the Asian guy gave me one, thats right, ONE container which was the equivalent to 1/2 ounce for an X-Large pizza.  I had to remind the guy it was an X-Large then he "sighed" and gave me another 1/2 ounce.  Thanks dummy 2 containers totaling maybe 1 oz of grated Parmesan for an X-Large pizza, bad attitude, overcharge on bill, I had enough of this BS so I helped myself to the one in the shakers and took care of my X-Large pizza.

Here's a tip:  Maybe you just need to get laid homie.  I know I always feel like a champ the next day. =D

PS: I found out later on that the awesome reviews from those individuals were of the Brother's Pizza from yesteryear's.  My how times have changed.  Lesson learned.
author: Sun T.

description:
Excellent slices. Excellent toppings.

Super sparse decor, but really cool pics of San Francisco from way back when.

Reasonable amount of street parking available.
author: S M.

description:
More like a 3 1/2...Good and unique selection of pizzas and Indian food. Excellent mozzarella sticks for a late night snack. Haven't tried the sandwiches. Delivery is fast, but eating in is better. People are nice. 
The reason I take a half off is that I usually have the Tandoori Chicken Pizza, which is delicious, but you definitely start to feel the effects of the spices pretty soon after ingestion. And I don't consider myself to have a sensitive stomach, so just be prepared. Well worth it though.
author: Alexandra T.

description:
I was introduced to Brother's by a friend of mine and let me tell you.........I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE Brother's Pizza!!!!  

From the outside, you look at the place and see an ordinary hole in the wall pizza parlor....and you figure a slice, how can that be enuf??? But wow!!!! once you see that your slice is covered in toppings (they do not skimp at all!!!) and YET, the crust does not fail underneath all the weight and YET still remains perfectly unburned and hard, you realize you are in heaven!!!  

My brother's staple -  slice with pineapple, sausage and garlic.  sounds strange, but it is OH SO FREAKING GOOD! 

I have brought my friends with me there and they all agree, it is delish!!! nom nom nom!
author: Jenna T.

description:
Excellent pizza! The Potato Pesto might be the best I've ever had - a must try! The crust is thick and hearty - the way pizza crust should be. The perfect late night snack after a night of partying. 

The restaurant itself doesn't have the greatest atmosphere- so I wouldnt recommended taking a date there, but is great for take out or late night dining when the atmosphere doesn't matter. Budweiser is the only beer on tap.
author: Fabiana D.

description:
Quite possibly the worst slice of pizza I've ever had, anywhere. Had been warned off already, but the scent wafting into The Riptide drew me in to try a slice on my way home. Don't make my mistake. Rating it 1 star is an insult to 1 star pizza takeaways.

On the other hand, if you like your pizza immensely thick and doughy (not Chicago thick, just bad crust and lots of it) with lots of plastic cheese, then this is the place for you. Definitely appeals to the "quantity over quality" crowd.
author: Doc Splendid E.

description: Biggest single slice of pizza I ever had. I got the vegeterian slice and the toppings were piled on top. Really awesome!!
author: Abigail E.

description:
Ahhh pizza, you are my carb-laden friend. Okay, only sometimes..
I don't even like red sauce but i'll eat pizza from here. They load on the cheese and are generous with toppings. The crust is not too thick, not too thin and stays crunchy. ME LIKEY.


HI ASHISH!! . =)
author: Susy C.

description:
I don't  understand why my bf and I went to get a sub sandwish at a PIZZA place when we've been craving Brothers Pizza's pizza for the longest time. It was all my idea though, so noone else to blame :)

We came late-afternoon wanting to get something quick, and I couldn't help but notice that they had a menu option called "JUMBO hot sandwiches." It was cold that day, so immediately I picked out the hot chicken parmesan sandwich. The wait for the sandwich was quite long, but after seeing the TRULY JUMBO size of it and feeling the burning warmth through the tin foil, I could tell they spent some time into making sure it was really fresh and legit for us.

The sandwich was large enough to be split for two people, although the bf finished the whole thing. I just had a few bites. The cheese and the chicken was a great mix, but I wasn't too fond of the tomato sauce. It was like a pizza made into a sandwich, which sounds pretty good, but the sauce was a bit too much for me. 

Also, we ate it right after it was made, and it was definitely too hot for my mouth. But it was good nonetheless. Next time I'll be sure to try the pizza, because you can actually see them work the dough and take it out of the oven. So it's guaranteed fresh. The crust is HUGE too, and there are SO MANY toppings, so you'll be getting more for your money indeed :)
author: Cindy S.

description: I was a fairly loyal customer until yesterday.  I forgave the sometimes soggy and slightly undercooked pizza because it was cheap and close to my home.  However, all that changed a couple of days ago.  On Saturday evening, I ordered a large pepperoni pizza for delivery.  The guy on the phone told me 30-45 minutes.  We waited well over an hour, and when the pizza arrived it was unbelievably soggy because of all the grease.  Additionally, the majority of the cheese separated from the pizza and collected in the corner of the box probably because the driver took a corner too fast.  When I called to complain, they told me I waited too long to complain, so there was nothing that they could do and did not even offer an apology.  I will never order from here in the future.
author: Gabrielle W.

description:
One bite was all I needed to get hooked!  

I had the vegetarian pizza.  It wasn't saturated in salt or preserved toppings.  Large portion of toppings. I also love how they sell by the slice.  This option saves money and doesn't leave me storing leftovers in my frige.  

 I wish they were open the day after Thanksgiving as I called in to order but met their answering machine.  Oh well, thats how sincere, local, family-owned operations run :o)
author: Honest J.

description:
Every time I get pizza from here, I get a tummy ache for hours. I come back the next time hoping it won't happen.

I love how ginormous their single slices of pizza are. I don't know why I get a tummy ache every time I eat the pizza here though! Blah, whatever. At least it goes away! I've had the mango lassi one time, and it was WAY too sweet for my taste. Well, I've never had mango lassi from anywhere else, so I'm not exactly sure how it should taste. If it's always that sweet, I'll pass. What I do really really really like, though, are their chicken wings. I did have a friend who had the worst reaction to the chicken wings though. He got sick and threw up and all. I've never had that, but I do avoid this place at all costs now...

Toodles, Brothers~!
author: Erica A.

description:
The pizza was terrible, the wings were terrible, the salad was terrible AND they tacked on a $2 extra charge (through Grubhub so I couldn't cancel the order or do anything about it) for my requesting to substitute tomatoes instead of mushrooms on my pizza. 

I will never order from this shady shithole again.
author: Mystery V.

description: This place had me in utter amazement when I had their mushroom and olive pizza - I consumed a large pizza to the face. I was also HELLA drunk.
author: Maple S.

description: Very nice pizza. Delivery was fast and pizza  was hot. Only con is that the deliverer was a little directionless and they misheard a little. Other than that, I highly recommend this place
author: Kevin Y.

description: I really like this place, their pizza is amazing and one of these days I'm going to try their indian food!
author: Alexandra R.

description:
The pizza here is alright.  For the price you pay for a slice, you're better off getting a full pizza.  

I think it's interesting that they put some Indian food ingredients, however it does not work...at least for me.  This place desperately needs fountain soda.  Be forewarned, drinks are pricey
author: Gabriel R.

description:
Made my first visit here today.  I live much closer to Zante's, which was my introduction to Indian Pizza.  I had a half Chicken Tikka Masala and half Potato (with pesto and garlic).  I'd have to say that Zante's version tastes more like Indian food and Brothers' tastes more like pizza.  I was in the mood for pizza, so that was better today... lots more cheese, sturdy but not too doughy crust.  They definitely load you up here... don't be surprised if the slices don't completely hold together.

Atmosphere is very hole-in-the-wall, but that's OK.  Nice that they had a flatscreen TV up with the Bengals-Rams game on.
author: Danny H.

description: Not only does this place have the best pizza around, they also have some of the best Indian food. Chicken Tika Masala, Tandori Chicken, Palak Pander, and so much more. This isn't a trendy hipster joint with attitude. It's a small local business that hasn't changed in 26 years, and they deliver!
author: Crimson Fiona M.

description:
always a go to place for pizza and indian food. 
i love how late they open, because sometimes i forget that its super late and i havent ate yet. they deliver which is Perfect. its really unique because they have both PIZZA and Indian food all together. if you're looking for some late night munchy during the weekend or just a easy food during weeknights, brothers pizza is great
author: Christine K.

description: I order from Brother's Pizza every 4 months. I order the XL All Meat special with the thick crust. It's the best pizza around. I always pick it up because I'm only 5 mins away. The guys there are always very pleasant and it never takes longer than 20 mins for pickup. The place is small but clean. I like that it doesn't have loud music or 10 TV's blasting at you like a lot of places nowadays.  I like thick doughy pizza with lots of meat and this pizza is exactly the way I like it. The only thing I would change is that I wish they open earlier like around 12pm instead of 3pm. I can honestly say this is my favorite pizza whenever I have a yearning for pizza.
author: Theresa W.

description:
Ok hands down if I want pizza I want Brothers. This place kinda rocks my socks. I love pizza with a nice thick crust, so if that's what you love then this is the place for you.  I like the pizza, the salads and the Indian food they have on the menu. I haven't really tried anything else. 

That being said, this isn't a place we go for fancy gourmet pizza, to me this place is more like comfort food. The portions are more then generous, the prices are fair, they are open fairly late and have enough on the menu to make everyone happy(including a ton of pizza toppings), best of all they deliver.
author: Yulia K.

description:
I used to always go here when my parents couldn't think of anything to feed us kids, and their food was heaven on earth. HUGE slices of pizza coated with a thick layer of cheese....YUM. Their combos are delicious, and everything is always fresh.

The prices have gone up, but that's normal, and this tiny place just feels like the easiest place to go and pick up a pizza. It's even by the beach! $2 for a huge slice of cheese pizza, change for each extra topping. You have to try it, at least once.
author: Colleen M.

description: Solid pizza in the Outer Sunset.   Unique flavor as I believe there is chicory in the dough--definitely the Indian influence of the owner and cooks.   This place is a Sunset original...  it might not become your favorite pizza, but its worth a stop.
author: Johnny C.

description:
ordered food at 6:30 
at 7:30, called eat24 to check 
then eat24 called brothers. brothers said the food is done just waiting on delivery guy...okay...i guess it is almost here so i will remain patient.

waited until 8:15 still nothing
called eat24 to check on the delivery. the guy at brothers said we already received it...really??? is that why we are still hungry and freaking ANGRY as all hell???? CLEARLY the food was delivered  to the wrong house.

called the place. they spent five minutes trying to tell me i received my food even though i was calling to complain that WE NEVER RECEIVED THE FOOD. WOW!!! 
NO APOLOGIES WHATSOEVER but felt the need to tell me "go ahead" and call EAT24 to cancel my order. oh why thank you brothers for the tip. no shit sherlock. no freaking shit.

ten minutes later Brothers called me back and explained they gave our order to someone else. thanks a lot defective pizza detective. thanks a lot.

consider two once loyal customers (for years) who would frequent weekly to NEVER come back.
author: Tiger Lily ..

description:
At 10:30 on a Saturday, my friends and I thought we should add to our How I Met Your Mother marathon by ordering the potato pizza here - garlic, pesto, and potato wedges. 

16.75 for a medium - that's sorta steep. However, good crust, and plenty of cheese, though not more than at pirro's. so, upon first bite, I believe that the potatoes have a slight dusting of curry powder - which is hilarious, but also delectable! The pesto wasn't strong enough, and I felt like it could have used more garlic and some parmesan (not the kind you dust, but the kind baked onto the pizza. 

I would come here again, maybe try the tandoori chicken pizza? This Indian pizza fusion thing sorta works for me.
author: Melissa C.

description: For the price and location, can't be beat. The pizza is decent. Salads are okay. But tonight, I tried the hot wings. OMG. They cook them in the clay oven! Fantastic. Not greasy. Perfectly seasoned. Outrageously good. I agree with previous reviews about the counter people. They seem like somebody has a gun to their head or something! But food comes quick and hot...so I don't really mind who's taking my money.
author: Sarah P.

description: I really enjoyed Brother's Pizza while in college and living in the area mostly for the convenience and cheap slice deal. But now, it's really not that great. Maybe it never was. it's a hit or miss really. At times you get it good, at times you don't. It's usually soggy with dripping oil, burnt on parts of crust. And it's ALWAYS salty. And it's no longer "that" cheap either. It's still a classic neighborhood joint but, I'd choose Domino's over it now.
author: Dan C.

description:
Order for delivery.

The order was delivered with errors. Asked for no cheese on my spaghetti, got cheese all over it, can't eat it. 

Also they sent two orders of fries wrapped in foil in a plastic box. The fries ended up steamed to mush. Every other place I have ever ordered fried stuff, they open a vent or a hole in the packaging to let out the steam so that the fried food doesn't turn to mush. Brother's Pizza assured me that's how they've been doing it "for 23 years". Clearly they are much smarter than me and I have no idea what I'm talking about  - nevertheless I ended up throwing away soggy mushy fries I paid $7.98 for and couldn't eat. If you're as dumb as me and actually expect food to be properly packaged and not crappy, maybe this restaurant is too smart for you too. 

Maybe the tandoori pizza is good. So far, I will only end up eating 2 of 5 items and I got an earful of attitude. Probably will not order again.
author: Robert F.

description:
Stay for the Pizza and the salads....not for the chicken!
My goto place for pizza and salads. Tired the other items on the menu....meh:( 
Do not order the chicken. it might be cheap, but it's like totally dried out and taste less. Pouring the BBQ sauce over it wont help either. 
Conclusion..Stay only for the pizza and salads. I do
author: Jeff J.

description: For a little hole i the wall place, its pretty good, you just got to know how to order a pizza. You need to tell them you want it thin crust and crispy.
author: Oscar R.

description: okay i had chicken tikka masala :] 10 bucks with tax it was enough to feed two small people lol the naan bread was crispy not soft but it was still good. Only reason i went there because its across the street from my cousins house so it was convenient. Had cheese pizza it was oily and i got the super sub brothers pizza and it was great good for 6 bucks!!!! Had a lot of left overs and took it home it was okay! cool they had indian pizza which is different lol didn't try it maybe next time lol at least they had indian people cooking because if i seen some other race i would skip lol thank you
author: Doris T.

description: This place isn't necessarily my favorite as I used to work for Village Pizzeria on Clement as well as Nizarios on Geary and so my loyalty is still with them because I know the quality and their business ethics. However, because of where we live right now in the Sunset, I'm grateful to have a decent pizza, with fresh toppings, killer pesto sauce and lots of cheese delivered HOT to me within 20min every single time, whereas normally delivery, even if their close to you can take at least 45min and comes luke warm.
author: Petra S.

description:
This place should be on " Diners, Drive- ins and Dives " because it looks like a dive on the outside but do not be afraid to go in and you can always pop on in the bar just next to it to wash all that gooey goodness down.

Nothing fancy about the place which is my kind of place.

Glorious pizza and I always have to have the garlic tators or wedges whatever they are called in this part of the world, they are just fabulous!! 
My husband is lucky if he can grab one before I bites his fingers off!!
author: Corina W.

description:
3.5
They have a bunch of pizza specials at reasonable prices. Their slices are really big and the taste is very comparable to north beach minus the cheese always slipping off. If you like thick crust, I would go here.
author: Robert Y.

description: Really good chicken tikka masala pizza. Such a treat. Ordered the small and easily split between two people--decent price! Simple pizza joint, close to the beach. Really great after a cold dip in the pacific!
author: Becca L.

description: Went to BP Sat eve, as we were at Ripkin & getting hungry. Bought a meatball sandwich to go, which we were were told would take 10 mins. BEST I HAVE EVER HAD! Served wrapped in aluminum foil, about 10"x3"x2"High on soft/toasted bread, sliced meatballs, sauce & yummy/thick (non-greasy) mozerella cheese oozing all over and out the sides). Served cut in half; half was enough for my man & I to have for dinner. Yes, we eat the other half 5 hours later. Counter person not friendly, but not rude. Don't know about their other offerings, but best dam meatball sandwich ever!! AND less then $7 out the door
author: Holly C.

description: Their to go pizza and slices are awesome and HUGE!! Can't say their delivery is as good (it was soggy) but I'll always go here as my go-to for pizza deliciousness.
author: Christine Y.

description:
Let's just say I made a Yelp account just to complain about this place.

I wanted to experiment as the yelp reviews were good and it seemed a good chance to take.  My foul.  This is the kind of place that turns the elderly into people fearing anything new.  You know the kind - the ones who eat at the same 2 places for 40 years.

After one slice i feel as though i still might have to run full throttle to the bathroom to hang my head over the throne. 

The ultimate fall of this pizza - that which killed all possible positive aspects, was that it was soggy.  All of the dough was drenched.  Not with grease - more as though it had been dipped in water.  It was so soggy in fact, that the whole bottom of the pizza box was wet as well.  It was horrific.  I have worked customer service before, I understand that occasionally people have terrible days.  Maybe their boyfriend or girlfriend broke up with them.  Maybe they are waiting to hear back on an abnormal biopsy or some godforsaken thing when they really-should-have-been-able-to-call-in-to-work-but-life-in-california-is-too-expensive.  

But honestly, this pizza was horrible.  I would call to complain to see if they would remedy it, but really, if you have to wait 40 minutes for a pizza and they can't get it right the first time is it worth the try?

I'm not one to go by first impressions.  I try to give everyone the benefit of the doubt.  But brother's pizza?  This was the kind of meeting where you would only offer a second chance if they were, say, your best friend's fiance or something.  

Brother's pizza, you fail.
author: Rachel M.

description: WAY too much cheese on all of their pizzas. The place is pretty gross inside too. Avoid it is you can.
author: Brett P.

description:
Brother's Pizza is absolutely delicious. One of the best pizza's I've ever had. They put on just enough cheese, their sauce is tangy, yet not overpowering, and they never skimp on the toppings. They don't have a very big beer selection, which is a bummer (only Budweiser on tap and very few bottled beers). 

I like a couple blocks over on 48th, and Brother's is the go to spot for pizza in my house. 

HOWEVER - The only thing stopping me from giving them four stars, is there service. There is an Asian gentleman who usually works the counter and is quite rude. In all the times I've dined there, I have not seen him smile once. I hate that I give my money to someone rude every time I go in there, but the pizza is worth it. 

The other reason I give this place four stars has actually nothing to do with them, except for their location.  They are right next to an awesome little dive bar called The Riptide which let's you bring in their pizza, no questions asked.  If you're looking for a quick bite and a couple beers, and you can handle shelling out a few bucks to a rude guy, I suggest Brother's.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
This place was Terrible.  We ordered based on Yelp reviews and either we got the odd-ball off or everyone just orders drunk and does not know any better.

Our pizza was soggy.  And I don't mean a little greasy or juicy, literally the crust was squishy like they had soaked it in the sink 20 minutes before attempting to roll it into a pizza and send it to us.  

"Flavor" was typical - nothing wonderful nothing terrible. However, the soggy aspect ruined any capacity for enjoying the so called flavor.  

Unless you want a pizza that tastes like it fell into a swimming pool before reaching your door, do not order from this place!
author: Sharelle W.

description: Be sure to try the BBQ Chicken pizza. I always get that with my usual Sausage & Mushroom.
author: Jimmy S.

description: good pizza, but poor choice to not accommodate a very hungry bar crowd next door and close early on weekends. you'd have so much more business. rude service most nights but just smile and wait for your pizza if you're hungry...
author: Mario D.

description:
If you order a whole pizza the pizza is actually decent. If you order a slice, however, it looks like the toppings are merely thrown on top of an existing slice of cheese pizza and then reheated.  Speaking of reheating the fries were terrible. Soggy and greasy. Seems like the fries had been cooked a while ago, left to sit, and when ordered thrown on a piece of foil and tossed in the oven. A sorry attempt at crisping up the fries.

I took a few bites of the food and choose to be hungry rather than grossed out.  I am now microwaving some leftover lasagna from the night before. Should've done that to begin with, would've saved myself money and grief. Sigh.
author: Jeanne L.

description: Just experienced Brothers for the first time yesterday as we came out from a long beach walk looking for something to take back to watch the sunset. Ordered two slices of the Gourmet Vegetarian Pizza. They were huge and generously endowed with lots of veggies - well worth the $4.95/ price. The atmosphere is definitely hole-in-the-wall. Even the slices are made to order so don't expect to grab&go. Sounds like the experience can be uneven from other reviews, but we will definitely be back.
author: Tom L.

description: love these guys!!!  cheesy, saucy, dough-ey.  what else can you ask for.  only suggestion is to stick to whole pies over slices.  tandoori chicken was tasty, too.
author: Choladeva C.

description:
The salads are great and cheap, the sandwiches have always been amazing, and I don't really have any complaints about the food.  

I am only giving three stars because of the service.  Almost every time I order, there is something missing/wrong.  Most recently my pesto cheese bread had no cheese (I double checked my order to make sure I did order the correct one), and in the past we have gotten the wrong sides, plain bread instead of garlic bread, missing ingredients on the sandwiches (which we paid for since they are "extras"), the wrong drinks, etc.  I like the food but its annoying that there is always an issue.  

Also, they do not put everything in a bag or two- the most they will bag is in a paper lunch bag.  Its not fun to try and walk up flights of stairs with a bunch of individual items.
author: S S.

description: Great little hole in the wall pizza place near the beach. Pizzas are of a large variety, and are out quick for take out or dine in.  The dining area is tiny, and if you're staying in the area the pizza's good for take out.  Hits the spot!
author: T L.

description: Ordered a pizza for delivery tonight.  It was delivered hot, and right on time, by a friendly driver.  First time trying this place and would def recommend it.  The pie was delicious and the price was reasonable.
author: Jasmine P.

description:
Dayum this place is so good! The don't skimp on the toppings or the cheese. The tandoori chicken pizza is delicious and the pesto is freaking perfect. 
The young guy working the front is pretty rude and a BAD pizza maker, don't let him make your pizza! Only let the Indian guys do it!!!
author: nedina g.

description: Pizza was absolutely fantastic.Antipasta was was a bit light on vegetables. LOTS of meats but could use some pickled vegetables even a pepperocinis but this has iceberg lettuce 2 sliced tomatoes and carrots that's it with lots of meat and a little shredded cheese otherwise I would have given the place 5 stars quick delivery
author: Judy S.

description:
We always got their menus rubber banded to our handrail of our stairs. They had pretty good coupons on it. We used to order pizzas from here quite often years ago. We stopped getting pizzas here believe it or not because the pizzas got smaller. They skimped on toppings and raised the prices. Also the quality of the pizzas weren't that good anymore. 

I've always received prompt and friendly service. 

Maybe I should give them another try. Who knows? Maybe they changed cooks and management since the last time we ordered from here.

I had to update my review since one of the reasons I've loved this place is they put so much cheese on the pizza it sometimes makes the middle soggy. Solution? I started asking them to bake it well done and they leave it in the oven just a bit longer and it comes out perfect.
author: Hyung L.

description: I eat lots of pizza. But this is my first time at brothers. Pizza was so oooooo greasey.  Never again
author: Lisa C.

description:
This was my childhood Pizza joint.  Pretty much saw it open when I was a kid and hung out here as a teen and now they are still here.  Must mean they are doing something right!  

Used to always be excited when we ordered from here.  My parents would usually eat Chinese Food at home but when we had pizza, it was definitely a treat.  Good thing they put those coupons on our gate.  You know coupons.  Those have guaranteed usage when my mom sees them.  LOL...  (Mom keeps asking "When's the coupon expire?  We have to use it by the expiration date...) hehe

Then afterschool in middle school and sometimes in high school, I'd hang out here and pick up a slice.  Those were damn cool cause they put loads of cheese on it.  

Great memories of this place for sure.  Haven't been here in a long while but I really should come back again one of these days.....
author: Mark W.

description:
This is a cool pizza spot that's by my house...yesterday we were feening for something quick and fast and we ordered from here.

We got 1/2 brother's special and 1/2 tandoori chicken pizza..I must say that it was pretty darn good! When my bf suggested we get the tandoori chicken..I was like, heck naw! But it was pretty darn tasty!! The brother's portion was good, too with sausages and salami - yum!

My hungover bff got some minestrone soup and he liked it alot...

Brother's is good for a quick slice or whole pizza..check it out.
author: Jade B.

description:
As I had been a regular customer for the past 12 years, I cancelled a delivery order, as these cotton pickin' greedy bastards are so damn GREEDY, they would not allow me to slide on a mere NINETEEN CENTS short of their twelve dollar minimum delivery cost!  That to me really sucks!

There food had made my late roommate sick once and their slop is really no damn good anyway!  They probably recycle out of various dustbins around San Francisco!  In fact the last time I had their food, it gave ME food poisoning that lasted a few days!

DO NOT PATRONISE THIS PLACE!!!
author: Akinato K.

description: I get the Indian food here. Not really into their pizza. Owners are nice food is good. The green sauce kicks ass. Also get the potato wedges with cheese and garlic.
author: Keyser S.

description:
Love love love love this pizza. My girlfriend and I recently took a trip to San Francisco and this just happened to be not only within walking distance of our hotel, but also right next to the bar that we frequented while down by the hotel.

We ordered a large pepperoni and each had a couple slices as we were drunkenly stumbing back to our hotel room and put the leftovers in our mini fridge. This was the single greatest decision we ever made. This was our lunch the next day and even cold this pizza is really truly amazing. The chewy yeasty crust and the slightly tangy sauce were the perfect compliment to the pints of steam beer I drank not 15 minutes prior to grabbing this pie.

If you're ever by the Zoo, grab a pie... not just a slice.
author: Gregg F.

description: Had pizza here last night @ around 11pm, I'm (Mister) from PA so it"s rare to find places open past 9pm.  They def didn't skimp on the toppings and as a fat preggo lady, THIS RULES!  The pizza RULES ;)
author: The Robertsons I.

description:
People may think I'm going crazy reviewing so many pizza places all at once but I feel like it's easier to comment on the same type of food rather than going all over the place all the time. This place is actually not bad at all. Located in the outer sunset area I would think of this as one of the hidden gems of San Francisco. After coming here for years this place can also be described as a hole in the wall as well with limited seating and a small tv to watch from but outside of that this place is great.

I know some others have had a bad experience here but I have never had such a thing happen to me. I always order my pies here for pick up because I feel the whole delivery thing takes away from the freshness of the pizza. I guess since I come here often I don't see the complaints of other people. The pizza has always been crisp, never soggy and the toppings used were always fresh. Now don't get me wrong, there may be a day where I am completely pissed with how this place has made my pizza, but for now I will say this is a place to check out if your ever in the mood for a good slice of pizza.
author: Jason Y.

description:
This is a very interesting pizza parlor. I came here the other after drinking in the West Portal district. Not that many choice in the day or night around here. So a friend got a slice of mushroom and I waited. 

I had wondered what was taking him so long, later to realize they were reheating it. Cool, nothing is worst than a cold pizza on a cold night. After i begin eating and warming up, we realized that this place carries Indian food too. We just had pizza that night but when I try their Indian I will update my review.
author: M C.

description:
A small place on Taraval and 46th aveune.Looks like crap on the outside and I have never actually eaten inside(small,yea).They deliver and that is where I have the most experience with this place.

Delivery has never been a problem.They are quite fast when it comes to delivery.Have yet to encounter a mean delivery person.


Good hangover food.The menu is decent too.

The Veggie pizza rocks my world.
author: Dani D.

description:
4.5 stars!

Another hangover, Another pizza day.  Thank god for Brothers!

I love Brothers Pizza!  I've been ordering from Brothers for a while and stopped for a bit because the last couple of orders the pizza came with the cheese and toppings shifted to one side of the pie. I assume this was due to the hill I live on but it ruined the pizza. After some hit and misses with other pizzerias I came back to old faithful and haven't had this problem since I've been back.  

The pizza is incredible!  I do ask for a little extra sauce all around which compliments the floury dough.  I've had the Hawaiian and the meatball pizza. The toppings are always in surplus and the prices are great for the quality you get.  

I've also had the cheese garlic bread, wings, their spaghetti and meatballs and their salads.  Everything is so good and plentiful.  They don't skimp around!
author: Frankie F.

description:
Hands down, Brothers' Pizza Special is an absolute beer swilling, lung burping, thump your buds' back in a Heimlich maneuver fashion, crowd pleaser.  We've ordered delivery from this pie place for a good 10 years and have never been disappointed.  It helps that we get regular coupons to defray the total costs, but it doesn't detract that the pizza has to be good for it to be ordered again and again.  Tons of pepperoni, sausages of unusual size, onions, and bell peppers.

We did Hawaiian style once to the glares of my shocked peeps and I haven't done it again. Truly, it's like a Lord of the Flies island rules here. The pizza was great and they had huge pineapple pieces all over. I love it...so what if it's fruit? (glares with squinty eyes).

Delivery is quick and the pie is hot and fresh.  A must for pie heads!
author: Pauline L.

description: Good selection of toppings my favorite is brothers special and chicken tikka masala.
author: Bariska Y.

description: It's a dive...I like their pesto cheese bread.  Delivery is not too shabby either and like it that they don't skimp on the toppings.
author: Emy B.

description:
I must say that Brother's Pizza has become a bit of a tradition for me and my friends for every Super Bowl or sporting event I have at my house.

As has already been stated that if you do order a pie with everything on it you will need a fork & knife to prevent it from falling to the floor. Their delivery is actually pretty good and it helps when you live 2 blocks away.

People describe their pies as "New York" style but, I like to think of it as San Francisco / Sunset style of pizza. If you live in the Sunset and even if you don't , you should come by this place and feed your pizza urge.
author: Mario O.

description:
Linguica & Pineapple. 2 years ago, you couldn't convince me that that combo was better than finding a shiny new penny. Brother's hypnotized me into believing it is the only thing left in this world that is right and pure.

Absolutely filling & tasty for less than $3.50...

...braaaaaainnnnssssss.....
author: Haz O.

description: The tikka masala pizza that we got last night was delicious (freshly hot and cold)!!  The pizza dough is made with naan, so it was just like eating the bread dipped curry with cheese.  Simply delicious.  It's a MUST TRY!
author: Lauren B.

description:
I'm not quite sure what kind of crack all of the reviewers have been smoking, but I definitely don't want any! I hear about people loving this pizza, but I'm not sure how you can taste anything underneath the pound of greasy, gross cheese on each slice. It's not like you would go back for the hospitality either. The guy on the phone was an asshole and seemed like he was annoyed to be bothered to answer the phone at all.

I've made an effort to try Brothers twice, and twice I've been disappointed. 

I keep making the mistake of trying pizza places that I don't know or that haven't been personally recommended by other ex-East coasters who actually know what good pizza is. Here and now, my fellow yelpers, I take a stand. No longer shall I order pizza from a place that other East coast pizza people have not personally recommended. 

As long as I have cash, I will stick with Victoria's (they charge extra to use credit cards). When I don't have cash, well, I'll have to go with Thai food.
author: Amy B.

description: When the delivery driver handed me the pizza it must have weighed upwards of 5 pounds. Dough was plenty doughy and tasty. We had the traditional hot wings, and the tandoori wings. Both were good, but i was partial to the tandoori flavor. Delivery was fast considering my distance from the restaurant.
author: Stephen C.

description:
I've had *MUCH* better pizza by the slice, but you can't beat it for being the only thing in a few-block radius, and being right next to the Riptide.

At least in this joint the prices actually reflect the quality, instead of paying $4 for a crappy slice.

I pay $2.50 for a slice of cheese, and while the sauce is DEFINATELY not the best pizza sauce I've had... I find myself actually enjoying the nice, thick, pillowy crust.

I'd be interested in trying other arrangements (like pesto), and seeing if they'll be accomodating if I bring in my own toppings (like vegan cheese)....

The "Greek " pizza looked uber-yummy, tons of toppings, flavors, and still under $5 for a decent sized slice.

3 stars for location (next to a bar) and for price.... loss of stars for sub-par tomato sauce.
author: Roachie D.

description: Decent pizza - it is within walking distance so I like to call ahead to pick up.  I like their claw machine there.  :)
author: Noreen F.

description:
I swear they have something against people who order delivery, because everytime I've ever received a pizza the toppings are sliding off the crust, and I'm forced to eat it with a fork. And what kind of self respecting person eats pizza with a fork.

I highly suggest getting the hamburger meat as a topping. Goddam delicious. I rarely actually step foot in the place, it's awkward and greasy.
author: Serene L.

description:
Pretty good thin crust pizza and good slices. Went there once and had some slices and really enjoyed them plus they had a huge salad for 3 beans. Normally do delivery and they are pretty fast. Would have given it 5 stars but I havn't tried much else in san fran (sorry, im new here).
Give it a try.
author: Scott H.

description: I have been coming to Singh at Brothers since I was a kid.  It is the best most incredible pizza in the City.  Piled high with thick cheese and toppings, homemade sauce, hot and fresh out of the oven.  Salads are well appointed and huge portions.  But the Indian food is outstanding. Singh does it all right on and his employees will go out of their way to make you happy.  Want a great affordable date night? Go eat at Brother's and go for a nice walk on the beach afterward.  Sunset Heaven!!!!
author: Faith J.

description: I ordered delivery from here more than a week ago, but I was so uninspired with their food that I wasn't motivated to write a review.  I didn't order their pizza, but I got an appetizer sampler, their pesto cheese bread and their ribs.  The appetizer sampler reminded me of something I could have bought at the grocery store and reheated myself.  And I would have actually done a better job!  The chicken nuggets weren't crispy at all and didn't come with BBQ sauce.  The mozzarella sticks weren't melty and didn't come with marinara sauce.  The hot wings were pretty good though and they did come with ranch.  The ribs were kinda flavorless.  No sauce again and I wasn't sure if they were even marinated before they were cooked.  The pesto cheese bread was pretty good, but could have used a little more salt or something cuz it was lacking in flavor a little.  Basically, I probably won't order from here again.
author: Elena N.

description:
Found a flyer for this place on the door to my apartment building.  Prices seemed good so I figured I'd give it a test run.

I ordered the 8x8x8 and a sausage sandwich.  The sausage sandwich left me wanting something from the east coast.  Who puts tomato sauce and tomatoes on a sandwich?  Classically I want sausage, peppers sauce and cheese.  *shrug*

I got the tandoori hotwings with the 8x8x8 and it was the best part of what I ate.

The cheese sticks and poppers really left a lot to be desired.  They weren't really well cooked, and the poppers had absolutely no bite.  Where ever they get theirs they need to stop.
author: Nate B.

description:
I don't order pizza delivery from Brothers, I order Tandoori wings and Calzones delivery from Brothers. 

The Tandoori wings are really especially good, I like them. I have been hard pressed to find another restaurant who sells Tandoori wings and delivered.

The restaurant doesn't open until 3pm, which is annoying if you happen to want to get 20 wings delivered for lunch.

The Calzones are reasonably good, but I asked them to make mine extra thin crust since they have a tendency to be overly doughy at times. Still, good tasting and with ricotta the way I like my calzone.
author: Kimberley M.

description:
I order from this place when I want a really, really good cheese pizza.  Any other night I order from Irving, Seniores, etc.  Why?  Brothers has great crust, sauce, and toooooons of cheese, but every time I've ordered pizzas with toppings theres been too many, and they've been undercooked (maybe you like crunchy mushrooms... I don't).  Seriously, the cheese slides off under the weight of a simple mushroom and olive topping.

But the cheese is A-OK.  Three stars!
author: Andrew C.

description: Strange combo of odd pizza and indian food. The slices we ordered were very doughy and the sauce rather bland.
author: Roberta B.

description:
Yes....when I'm in the mood for Carbs it's so on at Brothers!  Usually get the olives, mushroom, and pepperoni pizza...Very old school taste and reminds me of how Bruno's at Geneva n Mission "use to" be...

Just make sure you pay by cash....Extra charge on Debit/Credit Card for some bullshit reason...BUT, they do deliver to good ol' Daly City...So a score for them!
author: Stephanie O.

description: I struggled with this one.  It's a thick crust but a thin pizza.  I really think they nailed cheesy-oily flavor and the bottom of the crust is crunchy.  $2.45 for a cheese slice.  Good service.  Small typical take out pizza place.  A thumbs up from me.
author: Jeff J.

description:
Recently I've been trying to develop my taste for pizza. I've always *liked* pizza, but have never really been able to define what makes a good pizza other than by the toppings I like to put on it. And you can get okay toppings anywhere, I guess?

Brothers Pizza opened up my eyes to what really good pizza is suppose to be like. Or maybe the first time I ate it was the first time I really paid any attention to the taste, texture, smell, and appearance of the pie. Now, not very many can match this joint's slice.
author: Meghan L.

description:
Brother's Pizza and I have a long history. When I was really young, my family use to live a block away. My mom and I would walk to the Great Highway Liquor Store to buy lottery tickets...and then we'd sit at Brother's for a bit. The guy who worked there at the time was always really nice to us. One day, I left my favorite red hat there...and cried my eyes out because I would never see it again. 

Last year, I finally forgave Brother's Pizza for that traumatic experience, I discovered how good their pizza was. Now, I don't order delivery from any other restaurant. I go with the simple mushroom/sausage medium pizza. Each slice is huge. The sausage is ginormous too! 

Brother's gets minus .5 star for my traumatic experience and minus .5 for making the toppings so heavy that it falls off everytime! But oh still so good! Their delivery is pretty quick too!

Obviously I took away a star for dumb reasons...this place is closer to a 5! Okay I'm going to give it a 5...
author: Allan M.

description:
I can't believe this place is still around. This is another one of those places that have been in my neighborhood since I was a wee kid and they're here to stay.... at least I hope so. I have yet to find another pizza place that serves bigger toppings. It's not the best pizza I've ever had, but delicious nonetheless and you get a BANG for your buck.

Pizzas here are huge, they'll get a big guy like me filled up in no time. I swear this place could have come from Texas cause the toppings they serve are huge, like on steroids. The sausages are the size of Chinese beef balls, they're so heavy that they roll off the pizza slice. 

The pizzas are super greasy, but hey if you're eating pizza you shouldn't be expecting healthy. The sauce is a little thin and the dough isn't thick enough to hold all the toppings, but that's just the big toppings fault. Anytime I think of getting pizza in the area Brother's is always first that comes to mind.
author: Felix T.

description:
Two words:

HELL. YEAH.

Still soooo good after all these years. Try the chicken tandoori pizza - yum. How anyone could think this is bad pizza is beyond me...  Hands down the best pizza I've had since... well, ever. Plus they sell it by the slice, and for under $3 (for a huge slice). Salads are good too.
author: M C.

description: This pizza joint by the beach is a great place to go for a slice when you're pressed for time. I've been here twice and both times, my slice of pepperoni was served up to me fresh and hot. No complaints, and the customer service is good.
author: Rory O.

description: I have to admit that they don't have the best pizza, but it's local and cheap.  Always trying to support local business whenever possible.  It beats going to the chain pizza stores.
author: Jannie Q.

description:
Update 11/07: Pizza continues to be good, but on a recent order I was asked if I was "that one who always scratches out most of the credit card number on the receipt?". While it's hard to believe I'm the only person that does this, nevertheless I told him I was and he told me not to scratch out their merchant ID, which I did once by accident in a hunger-induced daze the last time I ordered from here. How about instead you get with the program and start complying with the law that states you aren't supposed to print out my entire credit card number in the first place? According to the FACTA, you have until the 1st day of 2008 to comply, so what are you waiting for? http://www.privacyrights.org/fs/fs6a-facta.htm

In my continuing quest to find good neighborhood eats ... I found myself ordering a slice at Brothers Pizza on a return walk from the beach on day. It was good and thick, however the pineapple on my Hawaiian wasn't secured and fell all over the place when I got to digging in. I've since ordered a pie for delivery there and do find it to be very good. Try the gourmet vegetarian which comes with artichokes which are one of my favorites. They're pretty quick on the delivery too and don't charge extra which is a plus.
author: Todd F.

description:
It is getting kinda hard to find good cheap pizza in the city. Brother's has been around a long time and it seems that little has changed about them over the years. Sure they don't deliver slices anymore, and the prices have raised over the years....but they are still a good pizza place. They put a lot of toppings on and their pesto bread is tasty alternative. If you live in the area and you want a good pizza fast and affordable, this is your place.

If you want a fancy pizza you should have gotten to arizmendi earlier.
author: Dixon T.

description:
Love love Brothers Pizza. The chicken Tandoori pizza is so good.  Warm cheesy pizza on a cold foggy night hits the spot every time.

ok perhaps only love it after cocktails at the Rip Tide. And the barbeque chicken is no bueno. Unless you love the skin of chicken parts.
author: Amanda L.

description:
We used to get this pizza all the time when I worked (and virtually lived) at SF State.  The pies were always good and the selection of toppings I remember being extensive.  While I don't remember the crust being as thin as Rick describes I know that it was good as the crust makes the pie.

Never been inside this place and couldn't find it on a map, only speaking of delivery.
author: Thadd L.

description:
Eh.  Not that great.  The pizza is one of the better things on the menu, but I wasn't that impressed -- sauce was too sweet and the crust was too thick for my taste.  The gyro sandwich is okay, relatively decent with salt and pepper added, but it's not really a gyro in the manner I'm used to getting them, meaning there's no pita bread on it and the meat is obviously frozen -- at least even the places that don't make fresh gyro meat try harder than this place.  I can't hold that against them though since it's their pizza they're advertizing...  Do not get the chicken nuggets, they're akin to what you'll find at your local school cafeteria -- tandoori chicken wings were passable, though they reminded me more of sweet and sour than tandoori...jalapeno poppers weren't bad.   Delivery was on par with other pizza joints.

You could do far worse, but when you can do so much better, why bother, unless you live right there...
author: Sus... B.

description:
Well, I went back after awhile away to sample the competition, and I've returned. I got a White Sauce Chicken Pizza (#16 I believe), and I have to profess my affection for this particular pizza. It's almost like a creamy pasta on bread!
Brothers now takes the reign as my all purpose goto in the Outer Sunset. If I want something especially good i'd probably hit up the Pizza Place on Noriega, but for regular days it's definately Brothers.

ps- they do serve all sorts of Italian and Indian food beyond just pizzas. Sandwiches and Pastas, as well as free delivery.
author: Josh S.

description:
Mixed feelings:

Some nights the $5 a slice combo pizza seems a bargain - fresh, hot, HUGE portion, generous fresh toppings, really delicious.

Unfortunately on other nights it seems they throw extra toppings onto whatever they have laying around and pop it into the oven to sort of heat up. The portion was at least 1/3 smaller than usual, the toppings meh and the cheese thrown on top and unmelted (granted it was close to closing - but if you don't have it, just say so, don't fake it)

Update 14JAN14: I don't order from here that much anymore, maybe once every couple of months (down from weekly in more prosperous times) but it bears mentioning that 4 of my last 4 orders had varying degrees of error in them (regular salad instead of Hawaiian, Red sauce on my pesto pizza, the spicy indian green sauce instead of Pesto (mouth burning, but interesting) and forgot to put pepperoni on my pie even though I checked it and paid extra on Eat24. The Eat24 mistakes are easy enough to get credited, but phoning directly results in a fairly surly "well what do you want me to do about it" type of reply. Not very customer friendly.
author: Sergio S.

description:
My family and I used to always order from this place after Domino's on 22nd and Noriega closed up.  I don't know how we chose this place but I guess we got enundated by the amount of flyers that Brothers Pizza dropped in our gate.

I always enjoyed Pizza from this place and the specials were always pretty damn good.  I remember getting a XL 18" pizza for 11.99 here before (im sure prices have gone up).  Getting a pizza never took too long except one time when the driver got lost.  The thing I love about Brothers was that the crust was thick as hell and they tended not to be cheap with the toppings.

Brothers is near the beach and out of nowhere but they do have a few seats here for you to eat if you can't wait to get home.  I do like how no one really eats here so you can eat in piece and use all the parmesan and chili pepper you want.
author: Jason Y.

description:
I really like the pizza here- probably my favorite in San Francisco. I do wish that the ambiance were better, though. It's not a fun place to go and eat in. The owner is friendly, but the teenagers who work there are always kind of miserable-looking and the dining room is not very comfortable or relaxing. The tables are too small for the chairs to fit very well underneath, there is a toy-grabber game that makes a lot of noise (but that I've never seen anyone actually playing), and it's too dark. They need to have napkin dispensers- normally they only give you a couple of napkins with the pizza, and it's annoying to have to ask for more. There is an old lady who comes in and sits around- she's almost always in there when I go in, and it seems like she just wanders in and hangs out since she has nowhere to go, and it's kind of depressing to see her asleep at a table when I'm trying to eat. 

I like the variety of toppings, especially the potato pesto, and the plain cheese is already really good. I agree about the need for fountain sodas. 

It's a shame about the dreary atmosphere. I would come more often if it felt more cheerful inside. I like the pizza here better than the Pizza Place on Noriega, but the atmosphere there is so much more cheerful and fun, so I end up going there more often.
author: Amber S.

description:
I'll tell you this, it happened the first month i moved to the sunset and i still haven't moved on.. I wanted to see if any of the neighborhood pizza spots around my house are quality. 

I ordered a large sausage and onion pizza and i personally set it on the seat next to me in my truck and carried it into my house. Once i got inside and opened the pizza, all the sausage was on one side of the pizza and the cheese looked ragged, like it was thrown together with no care.

Maybe it was a one time thing, but i know that was the condition of the pizza when i got it. It you want to chance it go ahead, if the pizza wasn't destroyed when i got it it probably would have  been great....
author: Joe W.

description:
i went here because the kids i coached kept saying how good it was.

i tried it out with a friend and we had a combination one of their specialties.

it was SALTY.  I guess it was just bad timing....but salty is something you can't forget.

i can only assume that the sauce was at the end of its run...you know how some places make enough sauce for the week?  i guess this place did that.

lots of parking for where its located.
author: Bing D.

description:
Brothers is simply the best for many reasons.

1- Their slices are HUGE and really cheap.
2- They make the slices individually when you order them so you know that it hasn't spent any time under a heat lamp.
3- Their crust is really thick and doughy which I love.  Also, I like that they use a lot of cheese, even though every once in a while it can be a little excessive.
4- It's one of the few restaurants right by my house.

The employees are generally friendly.  They have delivery, but I can't comment on it because I'm not lazy enough to have pizza delivered around the corner.

The only downside is that they don't open until 3, but I guess that's understandable considering the location.
author: Ashley H.

description:
This is the best pizza place in San Francisco.
The tandori wings are one of our favorites. THe sandwiches are so big, you can have dinner for 2 with one sandwich. 
The Indian food tastes home made. 
The pizzas are reeeealllly good. 
Totally recommend it if you're in the neighborhood. 
Don't let the outside fool you.
author: Luis and Yona V.

description:
I love Brother's Pizza, because, it is so OK!
Get the Artichoke slice, tons of artichoke hearts
in there. Helps you recover and get back to whatever
it was you were doing--surfing?---before you had to 
get something in your gut.
author: mickey l.

description: We've been ordering pizza from Brothers for about a year now.  The pizza is nothing spectacular...but the restaurant is not too far from home, the parking is easy, and the price is fair.  Be prepared for inconsistency in the pizza.  There have been times when the pizza was wonderful, then there have been times when the pizza was truly sad.  We've had pizza with wonderful perfect crust loaded with sausage and pepperoni, and then we have had pizzas with extremely thick outer crusts and paper thin inner crusts.  Our pizza night is generally Friday or Saturday night and I order through Eat24.com to take advantage of the weekend coupons, so my order is submitted on-line.  I have requested a regular outer crust and I think there is a 50-50 chance I will get the crust as specified.  My two kids have uniquely different taste in pizza, so we frequently request a half-half pizza.  I think that sums it up...half the time we will get what we request; then the other half is a crapshoot.  We get the Super Bowl Special which is an 18 inch pie with two toppings for $20.99...subtract $2.00 for the coupon.  Not bad -- when they are good.  But lately, the quality of the pizza is declining.
author: Knit K.

description: I can eat pizza at just about anywhere. PIzza is usually fool proof unless you really mess it up. So I usually get cheap pizza at Papa John's. But occasionally I wouldn't mind spending more for higher quality pizza. And if you want great pizza, the Tandoori Chicken Pizza is PHENOMENAL. I haven't been back in awhile but to my memory, it is fluffy, crunchy and the chicken is tender! Writing this review is making me crave some! It is a specialty pizza, so it is more expensive. People are saying a medium pizza is about 16.45, which is pretty expensive.. so maybe I'll opt for just a slice when I'm back in the city :D.
author: Theresa N.

description:
Cheap, Fast, Good Pizza

I live on the other side of the Sunset and within 20mins I have a steaming hot pizza with all the fixings. Pizzas are cheap (less than $15 for a large), and come with plenty of cheese, one of my flat mates argues that it's too much but it's Cheese,  without it, it's an open faced sandwich. 

If you live in or around the Sunset, order from here.
author: Will K.

description:
There are so many places to get from in the city. But I have to say that Brother's Pizza never fails me despite the rise in prices. 

It's great on the cold nights when you don't feel like cooking because you've working or at school all day or even those late final exam study nights. 

Our favorite is there White Chicken Pizza and I know it sounds funny and you may ask yourself isn't chicken white? But the white that's in the name is the type of sauce they use. You have to order this pizza with a thick crust because it just isn't the same without it. 

How can you not love a pizza that starts off with a nice soft crust topped with a creamy white sauce covered with mozzarella cheese and chicken.  Yum!

I say if you're in need of some 'grub' on those days when you just don' t know what to make...think Brother's Pizza.
author: Jessica L.

description: My wife and I love this pizza. Def. the best delivery in the neighborhood.  The toppings are all great...and put on thick.  The Hawaiian is great....the sausage, onion and mushroom....the only reason I do not feel like a piece now is that we just finished a few slices for dinner and I am satiated.  I just wish they were open earlier on weekdays.
author: David K.

description: By far the absolute most disgusting food I have ever eaten in my life. I literally took one bite and almost puked all over my floor. The food was cold and the service was colder. Still tipped the guy. Idiot! Please for the sake of decent food the world over do not even ever consider sniffing this restaurant. If brothers pizza burned to the ground the world would surely be a better place.
author: John M.

description: I always call in a Brother's Special slice for pick up. It's consistently good. The dough is never too hard or too soft, it's just right. The toppings are piled up high. It's about $5 for the giant slice, but it's like a meal in itself. I tried eating two, but one is more than enough. I recommend cutting it in half because it's so big. With a Coke or Arizona Iced Green Tea and a side of Ranch I'm all set.
author: Brian C.

description: pizza is ehh when your buck wild shit faced..be warned the pizza gives you really bad case of the farts i think its because of the sleazy cheese they use.
author: Omar I.

description:
My favorite pizza in the city. 

Let me just spell out a little scenerio for  you in one act and see if you agree...

Setting: Monday night, during football season. Chris and Adam are sitting in a relatively well kept living room, sitting on the couch, drinking beer and watching NFL football
Adam L: Yo man, you eat yet? 
Chris: Nah. 
Adam: Im ordering pizza. What you want on it? 
Chris: Whatever is fine, but you better be ordering from Pasquales
Adam: No man. Brothers. 
Chris: But you know the pizza is never cut all the way through, the toppings are all sliding off and the pie is cut into disproportinate size slices
Adam: Aww yeah... Thats why its bomb
(camera pans out to show teh whole living room. We hear some keypad punches on a telephone and some mumbling about a pizza)
Fade out

Fade in to same living room, Adam and Chris are sitting on the couch (Doorbell rings)
Adam L: Here is my card. Get it... 
Chris: Dude, dont be lazy. You made us get brothers, you got to get up. 
Adam: I AM PAYING. You get up and get it...
(Chris doesnt move and the doorbell rings again. Adam gets up and answers the door. Some mumbling about pizza and the door closes. Adam walks back in with a pizza box in hand and puts it on the coffee table. Camera zooms in quickly on the box opening and freezes on the pie. We see a medium pizza with pepperoni and shredded sausage. The cheese is piled up on the left side of the pie and there are 8 slices clearly cut, but it is not cut down the middle, but rather on the left side, leaving 2 tiny slices where the cuts intersect, 2 small slices and 4 HUGE slices on the right side of the pie)
Chris sighs...
author: Adam L.

description:
Hmmmm,good stuff.

I mean if you have a craving for some good pizza this is the place.

Some of the other stuff on the menu isn't so bad. I have tasted 
the garlic fries also.

Decent place in the neighborhood.

The stud muffin that I used to hang out with got me hooked on this place.

Yum
author: Mattee M.

description: The pizza is awesome and they don't skimp on the toppings and the tandoori chicken pizza is amazing. The service is great to.
author: Christina K.

description: I took a chance on the Tika masala pizza and it was good-very tasty.pleasant surprize.
author: james m.

description: Came here today earlier on a sunny day in SF.  It's just perfect that this place is by the beach and the pizza is decent.  Came here with 4 of my boys and we decided to split the large Tika Masala Pizza with curry-ish spices and chicken.  It was a nice change of taste from regular pizza and it turned out pretty good.  The place may be small and not something that stands out too much, but it was the spot we went to as high school kids.  It's always good to come back and revisit those spots from time to time.  But yes, the menu, as someone else had mentioned, is quite overwhelming.  If you come here, take advantage of the variety of different specialty pizzas
author: Vincent K.

description: Although the quality of the pizza itself is very good, i do have one complaint. We ordered the Green & White special pizza, which was delicious! But- we also ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza. And there was nothing Indian or Tikka Masala about it! If I hadn't placed the order, I would have had no idea that it was supposed to be an Indian pizza. So overall, I will keep this place in mind for regular pizza, but as far as ordering Indian pizza I will be sticking to Golden Gate Indian food & pizza. They know what's up.
author: Katie S.

description:
The best place for a slice of pizza in the City.  The best.  I live all the way downtown and Brothers is all the way by Ocean Beach.  Nevertheless ... the best.

Oprah is usually on the TV.
author: herbert r.

description: I had the good fortune to be one of the lucky 5000 in my neighborhood to receive a menu on my doorknob. A effective way to advertise even if its not so classy. It took me about 3wks before i broke down and ordered from them. I was so glad I did. I ordered the Brothers Special and it was fantastic. It was perfect drunk food. It was dripping with toppings and had a great crust. This  spells delicious to me. It had all you  need from a pizza delivery place. It was hot and quick. I didn't try the indian or italian food but since I'm def. calling back maybe i have my next review.
author: Greg H.

description: One two letter word sums up this place: ok.  I've had better (mostly) but also had worse.  The pie was good but the chunks of potato put me a little too in touch with my irish roots...if I wanted 16 potatoes on my pizza I would have asked for them...and the crust was soggy/damp which is my pizza peeve.  Why is it so damned hard to get a good pie???
author: Chris M.

description: FANTASTIC pizza. a very small place, i recommend getting your food to go. the few times i delved in to their other italian food choices ive never been very impressed but you cant go wrong with the basic slice of pizza for a good price.
author: Andrew D.

description:
Brother's Pizza is the perfect hole in the wall neighborhood place that makes THE BEST pizza.

When I first moved to the neighborhood I got my pizza from North Beach up on Taraval at 40th. Good, but a little overpriced. Brothers kept calling to me and I finally answered. 

The pizza is perfect - part chewy, part crispy, with lots of cheese and fresh veggies. The Brother's Special has tons of toppings and with 4 sizes to choose from you have a real crowd pleaser. Here's the best part: they will deliver a six pack with the pizza if you ask! Yummy Sierra Nevada, no less. 
The chicken parm sub is hot and spicy; the meatball sub perfectly messy. I would so love to give this place 5 stars but for one reason - they don't have any cold subs on their menu! On Fridays it would be nice to drop in for a crabmeat/seafood salad sub as a quick meal. But in the grand scheme of things it's a small gripe.
author: Kelly M.

description:
This place does not have any redeeming qualities. They aren't open super late, they don't have good pizza, they aren't nice guys.
The sauce tasted like canned sauce mixed with water.
the guy on the phone was rude and hung up on me.

the pizza crust is decent i guess. but thats about it.
author: Taylor C.

description: This is a great place to eat anytime you are craving pizza. I have been goin here since I can remember, and every time I go here I feel that the taste gets better and better!!!
author: Jarryd A.

description:
We ordered a potato pizza with pizza sauce and a cup of soup. around 8:05 p.m.  We received the food by 8:45.  It was great delivery.  Unfortunately, the food was terrible.  First of all, there was no pizza sauce on the pizza; second, the garlic was half cooked; and the crust wasn't even burned.  The soup was so salty that I added a whole cup of chicken broth in it and it was still salty.  We threw away almost half the pizza away and the other half is still sitting in my frig hoping they will call me and make us a new pizza and a full refund.

I didn't get tummy ache but I had an empty stomach when I went to bed.

I think I'll order Chinese food next time.
author: Rich W.

description: Ok so this place.... I used to come here often, but rarely now. The pizza is pretty good. The dough is made pretty thin, pizza taste is good. But they do tend to put a Lot of oil on it.. so that's a downside. A slice with a topping or two will run you 4 dollars. The reason why I gave this place a two star is because of the young employee that works that. I believe he works full time and probably even overtime, so everytime I'm there, so is he. Young asian male. He is the rudest restaurant employee I have meet thus far. I won't go into details but I'll just generalize. He is rude, ill-mannered, never smile or look at you, and just take your order and says, "Next!" You have to see it to believe it. I cannot even speculate how many customer he alone had driven away.
author: Eric H.

description: ...great place to eat before u pass out after partying at the Riptide
author: Tony A.

description: Am I the first to review this pizza house? Surprisingly good thin crust pizza with lots of toppings.  Made all the better by the fact that you can take it to go and eat it at Riptide next door.  The only problem is, its thin crust pizza with lots of toppings, so it doesn't really hold up too well under pressure and requires a knife and fork.  My buddy tried it by the slice and said it was terrible. Perhaps stick with the full, fresh-baked pie.
author: Rick H.

description: My friend said that this place had the BEST PIZZA IN THE WORLD, so I went to try it this one time and WOW.. it was ONE of the best slices of pizza I've had so far. It was sooo cheesy (endless) and delicious! The person I went with thought so too (and he is a very picky eater). The next time I ordered from there, it was still good but not as good. And the person I had it with thought so too for the couple times he went afterwards. So perhaps they are not consistent and or we were just SUPER hungry the first time. But either way, I say its pretty delicious. And a bit more pricey compared to some other pizza places- just a tiny bit.
author: Elaine H.

description: The Singh brothers have been baking pizza pies at this location since February 1987 - that's a quarter of a century..! I have been a customer of theirs since May 1987 - I have a Brothers' Special combination - but without the onions and bell peppers; I have sliced black olives and anchovies substituted instead (without extra charge). Thay use sliced fresh mushrooms, make their own dough, their Italian country sausage is just right, salami and pepperoni is evenly and generously distributed over the surface of the pie. Their green salad is $4.50 and the fancier ones are a dollar more - and the portions are very generous. I don't recommend buying by the slice - it loses its magic - get the whole pie and have some more later, or the next day at home (cold pizza in the morning is absolutely terrific - especially if you have a hangover). Football, Japanese beer (Asahi), and Brothers Pizza is the supreme combination..! Whenever I crave comfort food I call in a pizza from Brothers. Thank you, Singh Brothers for being there - may you continue baking pizza pies for another quarter century, or more..!
author: George B.

description: Great Pizza.  Friendly owners.  Favorites are the Brother's special and chicken pesto special.  Indian food are pretty good as well.
author: Jenny C.

description: The delivery guy was a nice guy.  The pizza was just ok.  Its super doughy with thick layers of toppings.  The cheese pizza put me into cardiac arrest.
author: Fatty A.

description:
In an effort to make my review short and to the point, I can sum it up by saying one word: "Meh."
