Like other Yelpers, I remember eating Brothers as a child. It was my first introduction to Pesto pizza, and I loved it! So now that I'm in the Sunset, I thought I would give it a try again. The delivery was extremely fast - about 15min. For a small pizza and soda I spent just under $14.

The quality of the pizza was average. For me, the crust was too bland, and there was too much cheese on it. The pepperoni was a little odd tasting too. All in all, the pepperoni pizza I had the weekend before at Nizarrio's was much, much better.
author: Marissa S.

description:
Too much cheese, too much oil, not a problem! Cause I just can't help but continue to order from Brother's! I usually just call in and order a slice of pepperoni and walk over to pick up (I live a block and a half away). Their prices have definitely raised over the years, but so do prices for every other place. 
Their slices are HUGE. So it's pretty much worth my 3dollars.
author: Diana W.

description: I grew up having Brothers Pizza almost every Saturday nights, depending on our schedule.  My family would have our 'usual'; pepperoni, sausage, olives, and onions.  I love the pictures on the walls of old San Francisco in the early 1900s, before and after the earthquake.  One vivid memory I have going to Brothers was when I was around 7 or 8 or so, the owners, who are the ones who make the pizzas and what not, would give me and my brother some dough to play with while we wait for our pizza.  The owners are like family to me, as watched me and my brother grow up.  This place is an excellent pizzeria.  If you want to have some delicious pizza, it's best if you go in and order and if you want to eat it there, go ahead and enjoy the local sports teams play, or take it home.  This place is one of my favorites.
author: Amanda Y.

description: The pizza is awesome.  Among the best in the city.  They get a major negative as the guy that works the phone / customer interface is a total A**shole.  I used to be a loyal customer and am switching over to "The Pizza Place on Noriega."
author: HapaPower S.

description: It's pizza--you'd be hard-pressed to find a bad pizza review on my list unless it's for Domino's. Chunky toppings and they're not stingy w/ the olives. The proximity to home cannot be beaten. Not the best, but I do repeat offend.
author: Mar M.

description: These guys make a good basic pizza! They also got slices that go pretty well after having a few beer at the bar next door!
author: Bumble B.

description: Moved from downtown to this neighborhood & was looking for good pizza to recommend to our guests at the Days Inn on Sloat Blvd. A regular guest of the motel recommended this place and i was very impressed. Very good pizza & I like the indian twist on some of the pizzas and also the other Indian dishes. Have recommended this place to our other hotel guests and they have all been pleased with Brothers Pizza.
author: mark m.

description: This is perhaps the best "San Franciscan" pizza I've ever had. I'm not a big fan of San Francisco pizza style in general (Chicago Deep Dish ftw), but Brothers manages to do it right. Plus, their per-slice deal is wonderful! I've never gotten a bigger slice of pizza in my life!
author: Morence L.

description: Brother's is truly a special place. It has to be the best pizza in the city, or at least in the top 5. Theie tandori chicken pizza is somthing truly unique and delicious. A must try.
author: Casey D.

description: This pizza is off the hook!  It's in my neighborhood and they deliver.  My husband loves the sausage (I don't eat pork so no comment) and says it's good quality.  I've never had a bad pizza from here.
author: Michelle M.

description: IMHO it's pretty hard to find a favorite neighborhood pizza place and Brothers is it for me.  My b/f ONLY orders a ground beef pizza (blech imo) and I always get the veggie which is one of the best I've had anywhere.  So leftover time rolls around and b/f had to resort to a slice of my veggie and actually admits, "mmm, they make a damn good veggie I must say..."  See?  I wasn't lying.  I love the brother owners...couple of kewl guys...though the atmosphere isn't very kewl (but really clean) so we always get to-go or delivery and so does most everyone b/c those delivery guys are always on the go.
author: Jeannie C.

description: Decent pizza by the slice, conveniently near the Riptide, and one of the better restaurant inspection scores on this end of Taraval!
author: Bruce S.

description: Rainy day, decent pizza. It's not their fault that they have so many choices that I get overwhelmed and order against my pepperoni craving. I'll try the pepperoni soon and then will be able to tell -for sure- and maybe upgrade them to 5 stars.
author: Cate F.

description: I had a pizza party and a friend bought a Hawaiian, pepperoni, vegetarian and cheese pizza. The pizzas were good quality and had tasted great the next day. I have never been to the restaurant but the take out pizza is great.
author: Ginny M.

description: Medium pizza w/ olives, whole tomatoes, and salami for $16.54, coming to a total of $18 after tips. Pretty good pizza and I like the fact that it's a local business and not a chain. BUT delivery freaking took an hour!!! I could've walked over from work and picked it up myself. Good pizza though, especially if you like cheesy pizza. Oh, they don't open until 3PM on Fridays...not sure about the other weekdays, but if you try to call in and order, the automated machine will pick up and let you know that they are closed.
author: Audrey T.

description: I used to live across the street and I do REALLY miss it. My favorite was the chef's special sandwich. My friends used to say the pizza there hurt their stomach I say their wimps. All my roommates used to love it. If only I still lived close!
author: Erin O.

description: This place is good........I always forget about it whe ordering.  Used to be a college favorite in the 90's, not that I want to age myself or anything.  Tandori chicken with pesto is the foo-foo favorite, brother's special is the "i want to grub" favorite.
author: Rio K.

description: Second time eating it in the last couple of months. Beats Domino's around the corner from me..:D. They are cheap....they deliver...and the pizza is decent...although the linguicia I had last night wasnt what I was expecting. Overall, a good pizza that is not crap like Domino's.
author: Dustin L.

description: I would like to add more stars because I heard the chef play some acoustic Portuguese songs at the Riptide and he was really good, but I can't. The pizza is not yummy. My search for good pizza continues.
author: Rachel B.

description: My sisterinlaw took me here a LONG time ago.  But from my memory, it was bomb. and I've been longing to come back for a visit.  I'll be sure to update when I do...
author: Leslie Y.

description: Really Hung over, all I remember is going to a russian resteraunt the night before and all I know this morning is that my mouth tastes like parliaments and I made a complete ass of my self last night, but thats not important, I cant stomach anything down today when I suddenly get a craving for pizza. I call brothers pizza and order a mushroom and sausage slice, nothing is more comforting then the crunchy slice of pure heaven that is topped with mushrooms and sausages, the ranch that I ordered was incredible small but whatever. After this satisfying slice im once again restored to my former self and ready to take on the world again. Great place.
author: Sergey A.

description: I'm happy because they have turkey sausage here! As a non-pork eater, it's nice that they have a poultry option!
author: Al T.

description: Cheeselicious! ...a huge slice of super yummy toasted cheesy thin crust, but still chewy and just bready enough to soak up the cheesy oil.  Did I mention how cheesy?  I really loved my pesto slice.  You can get a slice of whatever you want, they make it just for you, and the dingy place makes you forget you thought you needed to vacuum and sweep at home.
author: Today Y.

description:
as a brooklyn native, i must say that most of the pizza in sf is garbage, and brother's wasn't a disappointment compared to the rest of the city's pizza, but definitely not noteworthy.  i'd opt for delivery from irving pizza or seniore's or georgio's before settling on brothers.  the only time i go to brothers is if i'm going to riptide nextdoor.  

i also tried a salad and sandwich from brothers.  all of the ingredients are really cheap, cafeteria grade.  the bread was really cheap and tough, even when toasted.  the meatballs were too rubbery.  the salad was made of cheap pizza ingredients and what looked like strips of pollyo string cheese.  and oh yeah, the wings are like bbq chicken and are too moist and mushy.
author: colin b.

description: Big, delicious slices with plenty o' cheez. I love eating pizza at the beach, the white noise distracts me from the variety of lipids attacking my arteries.
author: T.Z. R.

description: This place is just alright. It's cheap, definitely one of the better delivery places in the city, and they don't mess up your order (not usually anyway). But don't expect a special experience. It's just the neighborhood joint, and although they are definitely light years ahead of let's say.... Pizza Hut, they're just ok. Try it when you're in the area.
author: Clinton L.

description: This is a decent pizza place. The only place I have pizza from in the Parkside. That's right! Its in the Parkside, not the Outer Sunset. There are better places in the city, but Brothers produces a good pie and its close to my home.
author: Paul C.

description:
The pizza was pretty blah, nothing to write home about.

The worst part was how rude the guy who answers the phone was.  

Other times I've gone there in person, he has been so degrading in his attitude that it pretty much ruined the experience for us. 

And with the place looking a bit like a dive, getting so-so pizza is not worth it, especially with a Pasquale's right nearby.
author: GreatAlfredini J.

description: I want to rave about the tandori chicken wings.  We would go for pizza on the way home from the Riptide, but then I looked at their menu and went for the wings and never looked back.  10 wings for $5.99.  They are cooked in a wonderful spicy sauce that goes great with Riptide beer.  They stay open till midnight on weekends.  Crazy menu includes barbecue, clam chowder, pizza, indian food, spaghetti, greek salad.  If you are with a group of people that cant make up their mind what they want, bring them here.  Grab some food and go to the beach just 2 blocks away.
author: Molly B.

description: One of my favorite pizza places. Gigantic slices, fresh toppings, amazing pizza. I grew up just a block or two away from this place and my sister brought me here one day. It was one of my first few times eating pizza and it made it memorable and good. Also, many experiences revolved around this place. Thumbs up
author: Jonathan L.

description: Favorite pizza for delivery, hands down. They aren't too fast and the x-large pies run ya about $24 but the Brother's special.... oh my god... the fantasticness of it all. You do need a fork to attack this puppy because it is piled DEEP with tons of meat.
author: Mindful Indulgence S.

description:
If you're feeling a little naughty and you're looking for big portions of greasy  tasty pizza slices, you have found the right place. Whenever, I'm broke and feeling hungry, I come here. However, when I'm counting calories and have cash to spend, I run away far, far, far away. It's a double edge sword. However, the folks who run this place don't make any excuses, and they are all cool. 

Cons: Calories, Calories, Calories!
author: Akinyemi O.

description: My girlfriends been a fan of this place since she was a kid, the pizzas are good and its fairly priced, owner is pretty friendly.
author: Bobby S.

description: Excellent place! The pizza is well priced and the portions are HUGE. To reiterate it is THE BEST PIZZA EVER! Great place to go with friends. They take the burning hot pizza out of the oven, cut it, and put it on your table. I've gotten deliveries from Brother's and have dined in many times. Excellent place to take a group of friends, have a good time, and get FULL of delicious food.
author: Vincent T.

description: I've eaten Brothers Pizza's two-topping, 18 inch, extra large Super Bowl Special many times over the years and it's nice to support neighborhood shops. Though the Special is a great value, their quality can be a hit or a miss. The pizza crust can be incredibly fresh, bready and delicious; yet, other times, it's flat and bland. The dough gets ridiculously soggy in the center from the heat of the sauce, cheese and toppings. Not sure if they make their own pizza sauce but it ranges from being flavorless to overly sweet. They don't seem to use shredded mozzarella cheese; so, when you bite into a slice, you'll be chewing on  thick, chunky layers of cheese. Nothing more appetizing (or not) to see crimson red oil from meat toppings pooling in the center of the pizza. And if you get meat slices like pepperoni or Canadian bacon, they throw them on top of one another in the center of the pizza, preventing the bottom layers from browning. I'd recommend eating their pizza only a few times a year; any more frequent and you'll get tired of them quickly.
author: Cliff W.

description: $2-$4 a slice of pizza,  twice as big as my face is so worthed. And is by the beach. Friendly customer services.
author: timmy w.

description: Picked up two slices for me and the husband for dinner. Not bad, although they forgot to add pepperoni to my slice, and I was a little bummed. Sauce is a bit too acidic, but all in all it hit the spot. I will be back to try again!
author: Camille B.

description: Pizza slices are always good here and they are chill folks...  will usually get them when i am low on funds and don't feel like cooking since one slice will fill you up and is under 5 bucks...  sweet spot and the wings and other things on the menu aren't bad either!...
author: Anthony Z.

description: absolutely wonderful.  hands down the best "slice" of pizza i've ever had.  two slices were nearly a pizza and buried in thick toppings.  i can't understand how anybody could not be impressed by this place, let alone dislike it.  i had the tandoori chicken and the tikki masala both were excellent.  i will swear by this place as long as i live.
author: Ryan H.

description: Ugh.  Even by San Francisco standards, this is a terrible slice.  Doughy crust, strangely sweet and metallic-tasting sauce, stringy cheese, this was two bites and then to the garbage.  Yuck.
author: Todd K.

description: A LONG time ago when I was a wee lass I had a slice of Hawaiin pizza from this amazing place somewhere in the city.  I happened to be hangin in the sunset the other day and ordered pizza from this place called Brother's that sounded strangely familiar. It all came back to me in that one radiant moment.  Brother's Pizza is awesome.  Fatty crust, lots o' cheese, sauce that doesn't give me heartburn, and tons of ham on the Hawaiin.  I haven't tried anything else there, just the salad (great) and pizza, but I'm sold.  If you don't like Brother's pizza you are not a connoisseur of pizza and you will only embarass yourself by writing a contrary review.
author: Katie P.

description:
Myself & a bunch of friends decided to try these guys out lastnite. I called and began ordering, started with a tandoori pizza, then remembered I wanted a plain cheese slice for my daughter and had better put that in before I order the rest! It went a little like this: 
.......... We dont deliver slices ............ Huh? What you mean? ............. We dont deliver slices ................. Erm, are you telling me with the amount of food i'm about to order you wont put a slice in with it??? .............. Silence ............... more silence ............ Hello, are you listening to me? ............. Sorry maam, what was that? ,..................... I said cant you just put a slice in there because i'm about to place a pretty big order here ............... Hold on ...............( mumble mumble mumble) ............. No maam we dont deliver slices .................. Ok, i'll get my food elsewhere .......... I Hang up
Morons! I added it up and between my husband, daughter & I we would've spent at least $50 alone on what we were going to order, between pizza's, pasta, appetizers etc., and another 6/7 people that were also going to add to the order?? I say again MORONS!!!
They obviously have so much business that they can afford to turn down custom in this economy ............  or can they???? Are they simply just MORONS!!!!!

Needless to say I will not even attempt to give these people my money again!
author: Maureen D.

description: as my testament to laziness continues, my Mum's house is 3 long blocks from Brothers and we still order delivery. so instead of driving 15 seconds or, God forbid, trudging over on foot, we wait 30-55 mins for delivery and by then we are having at this pizza like aztecs clamoring at a young virgin for sacrifice. we've been eating this pizza since forever but not a one of us has seen the inside of the restaurant. imagine. our favorites range from artichoke hearts (yummmm) and chicken breast to pepperoni and sausage. always a good pie for sure. try the pesto, garlic & clams too, what a delight that was. and this is another pizzeria that gives you a true X-LARGE when you order xl, not some half-assed miniscule thing that wouldn't satisfy a gnat. hope this place is around till eternity and then some
author: Prima D.

description: Little known pizza place in the sunset.  Love their sausage which comes in huge chunks and are so good.  My favorite pizza place.
author: Stanley T.

description: Been going here for years.  The pizza is always great and tasty.  We're indian and ask them to make it spicy.  Always great tasting and affordable.
author: Cabo G.

description: Absolutely gross.  Normally, we write notes on menus to highlight what we like and what we don't.  This menu I just wrote REVOLTING, DISGUSTING across so I don't make the mistake of ordering again.  My dog liked it, but it was so greasy on only gave him a slice.
author: Laura T.

description: So going out Saturday night and coming home craving pizza is always bad haha. So i resisted pizza late night but it was still having that pizza itch Sunday morning. So thinking back to a poker game at a friends house where we ordered from  Brother's (The Brothers special) and how great it tasted that night I figured I can't miss. Placed a order for the Chef's special add garlic and waited for it to show up while watching the game. I arrives fairly quickly i would say 40 min's tops. So i bring it up and dig in with a friend.  First off when i open the box i see the pizza and its a bit watery in the middle which is so not what i consider good pizza. So I'm already not as into the pizza prior to delivery. Of course though I'm going eat it. Well it was ok, not bad, decent, I've had worse haha. Overall it was a fairly average. You would expect more from a pizza called the Chef Special. I can say next pizza craving will probably be North Beach who are also a bit cheaper.  I would however give them a extra half star for fast delivery.  It could have been just a off day for the pizza chef but based on this pie I'd have to say 3.5 is what they deserve
author: mitchell l.

description: Lasagne is great, but the tandoori chicken is not very good.  The place has a mixed pizza and Indian food menu, but I only really like the lasagne.
author: Thomas P.

description: Dark, Dingy and hot.  And oh, the slices really are horrid here.  This place is now known to my brain as quite possibly the worst slice of pizza I have ever had.  Ever.  I went in after my first visit to the Riptide (awesome!) and then hoped to have a tasty slice.  While the price was uber cheap, I waited nearly five minutes for a slice of pizza on what actually was tasty and crusty thin style bread, but there was an abundance of white, nasty mozzarella style cheese that tasted like, well -- nothing.  It was tasteless and as an added bonus I received one of the cook's eyelashes on the upper portion of the slice.  That was enough to make me vomit up my really tasty and cheap Riptide Guiness.  Thankfully I didnt, I took the slice to go and tossed it next to the overflowing dumpster of a Chinese restaurant on Noriega Street across from the Safeway -- about the best place a slice from Brother's could possibly end up.
author: Taylor P.

description: not a bad place i just think the workers could be a little more happier. when i go in it feels like they dont want me there you know. not really authentic italian food. but a slice of pizza is a little more than seniores. BUT they give you a whole lot of toppings. i guarentee 1 slice will fill you up.
author: Nicholas Y.

description:
We are on the search for good delivery (of anything) out here in the fog belt.  Tonight we tried Brother's Pizza.  
1.  Delivered in under 45 minutes
2.  Food was hot
3.  Order was complete
Sweet!
The pizza was actually pretty good, a little on the thick crust side for me even though they called it thin.  It was hot and the sauce actually had flavor.  My boyfriend really liked it.  I asked for ranch and got a full 8 oz plastic tub of it.  The ranch was tasty so I am looking forward to eating it on tater tots tomorrow and something else the next day.   I also ordered minestrone soup which was just like my mother's...a can of progresso.  I LIKE progresso minestrone, which is what I always had growing up, so I really didn't mind at all!  Having worked in countless delis and pizza places in my earlier years I know very few of these types of places make their own soups and just appreciate that it isn't the Smart and Final brand or something.
All in all...Brother's pizza, I will call again, even when I'm not hungover, which means it was great!!
author: nicole p.

description: Best pizza on Taraval street. Sometimes the dough can be alittle thick but still pretty good!
author: Happy G.

description: Nice people, generous slice, tasty.  Olds pictures of SF are classic.
author: Allan B.

description: I have to give this place five stars because I use to go here since I was a kid with my dad and it brings back memories. The pizza itself is pretty good, it's better than dominos, that's for sure.
author: carlos r.

description: The pizza here is not good, even for SF. The dough is too thick and the ingredients are all cheap. There are better options in the Sunset for pizza.
author: jon p.

description: my favorite pizza ever since i was a kid. slices are good sized and cooked to perfection. only thing i might like is a bit less cheese.
author: Bobby J.

description: its alright pizza. im eating a slice of pepperoni pizza that i got from there take out right now. i dont think ive ever said this before about a pizza but their pepperoni is mad salty. they need to tone down the salt in their pepperoni shits really gettin to me. crust is soft and good. seems like i would like this a lot more if i was wasted and ordered it for delivery.
author: Wats C.
